review.title: Good location. Great views
review.reviewText:
Very good. Concierges very helpful
No more!!!'
Poppoopoppoooopooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooppopppooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo

review.title: A reliably pleasant experience.
review.reviewText: One of my favorite hotels on the west coast. Beautifully furnished, gracious and pleasant staff. Limited dining options but 24 hour room service.
review.negativeRemarks: More dining options.
review.locationRemarks: Buy a pass and ride the cable cars!

review.title: traffic noise
review.reviewText: Our room was on the street side and there was a lot of traffic noise all night.

review.title: Invaded my privacy.
review.reviewText: Very noisy, my room is on third floor, I hear children's laughing playing and screaming from 1 AM till about 4:30 AM, I was wondering why they are still making noise that time of hour, maybe the hotel is haunted. The staff that delivers my food on my first night was friendly at first then I found out he was flirting coz he keeps knocking on my door every 10 minutes offering to give me wine, fruits and water, or if I want something to eat, he said I just give it away, he said normally I do that to some guest which a surprise to me. I ordered only a glass of wine and appetizer that first night and after 10 minutes he came back and knock on the door offering the remaining bottle for free and gave me a whole plate of assorted fruits and Evian water. He was asking me until when is my stay at the hotel and he said if I needed something he will be around till 11PM his shift. The next day, I was back at my hotel in the evening, he knock again at my door and asking me if I want some food, I refused and told him I don't feel good and I have a splitting headache I need to rest and I said thank you for the offer, He asked me if I have a company in my room, He said he will be back shortly to bring another bottle of wine and Evian water, after few minutes he knock again & hand me the wine and water, at my front door and said it's my last day of stay, and saying good bye, He grab my head forcely and steal a kiss on my cheek twice. I immediately closed the door and double locked it. Scary.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to changed from top management to bottom, hotel needs to update and renovate. Looks haunted.
review.locationRemarks: Nice locations.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: While this was a great location I would probably not stay here again. The bed was one of the worst hotel beds I have slept in in a long time. There was no coffeemaker. The layout of the bathroom was awful with no countertop space whatsoever. The water pressure in the shower made for a very long shower to get the shampoo and conditioner out of my hair.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything I mentioned above.
review.locationRemarks: It is within walking distance to Union Square and there is a wonderful steakhouse restaurant nearby called The Big 4.

review.reviewText: Location-wise, this was perfect for anyone coming into San Francisco for a concert at the Masonic, which is just a block away. The staff were great. The hotel feels a little old, as it is in an old former mansion and cultural center. But it is fancy. The late night room service was incredibly overpriced and subpar, awful burrito. The doormen, concierge and front desk staff were awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Late Night room service food
review.locationRemarks: One of several hotels just one block away from the Masonic.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: A hotel with an excellent location to explore the city. Satisfactory services and care

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Can take the cable cars in all directions. Staff was very accommodating. Top of Mark was the best
review.locationRemarks: Everything is a cable car away

review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and we had a wonderful time dinning in the restaurant and dancing all night  at Top Of The Mark!

review.title: Nice hotel with a lot of history
review.reviewText: It's close to Union Sqare and it's easy to get to all the touristy places. The bathroom was way too small the sink was out in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: On the top of the Mark you have nice entertainment with beautiful views of the city
review.negativeRemarks: I think they should have kept breakfast on the Top of the Mark
review.locationRemarks: It's convenient to everything shopping , good restaurants and entertainment

review.title: old San Francisco charm
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for a family vacation.  It's in a great location close to Union Square, Chinatown and more.  The hotel offers a complimentary town car service within a mile and 24 hour room service.  The rooms were great and we had a fantastic time!  Staff was exceptional from concierge to check in staff to doormen.  Make sure to go to the Top of the Mark for great views and drinks!
review.positiveRemarks: close to shopping and 24 hour room service and, of course, Top of the Mark!
review.negativeRemarks: longer times for town car service
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, shopping, Chinatown

review.reviewText: Hotel staff don't anticipate or offer help but you still need to ask them.
Loved my stay at the Mark Hopkins.  The staff was courteous and knowledgeable.  Everyone was very helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I only stayed at the hotel one night. It was close to China Town and downtown. Located at the top of a hill provided good exercise when exploring the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy walking distance to the city and sights. Great views from my room.

review.title: Top notch from beginning to end
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel for a major wedding anniversary.   From my very first call they took this event as extremely important; not only for my mental comfort,  but for my wife's physical comfort too.  Everything about this experience was top notch.   Lobby,  room,  everything was beautiful. Yes, it's true the hike up the hill can be challenging but it's worth it the climb. After all it's the San Francisco experience.   Mark Hopkins hotel you got it right.   Keep up the good work.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Cable car connection convenient.

review.title: Nice hotel, great staff, not the best bed
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the staff very helpful and professional. The concierge was awesome! The only down side was the bed and pillows. The mattress wasn't the quality you would expect in a 4 star hotel. They put a cushioned mattress cover (could have been down but I'm not sure) but it slides around as you sleep and starts to come off the mattress. Their pillows are awful... Thin with not much cushion to them.  They need to upgrade to nicer pillows. Also, they charge $7 for a bottle of water. I thought that was kind of ridiculous

review.title: Close to the cerntre and transportation
review.reviewText:
In general we enjoyed our stay. The staff were freindly enough especially the door men, who were very freindly. The concierge were extremity accommodating and professional. The hotel is at the top of the hill and it's quite an exercise to climb up and down when going to union square area, but then you can always use the cable care, which costs about 7 dollars one way or 21 one day pass multiple trips. They also have weekly passes at a rate of 50 dollers. 
The Asian reception staff could probably could be a litter bit more cheerful and remember that they are working in the hotel business where welcoming people and understanding their needs is esential.

photos.caption: View from the Top of the Mark

review.title: Great location but bathroom was too small.
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Inter Continental Mark Hopkins for more than a week and had the greatest of times.  The Hotel location and beautiful facilities are its greatest assets.  However, the bathroom - although clean and well equipped - was too small.  It did not have a counter or vanity in which to place the toiletries, etc.  This proved rather inconvenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Again, the bathroom facilities are too small.
review.locationRemarks: You have the greatest views to San Francisco, you can dine or brunch at the Top of the Mark (its penthouse) and watch it all.

review.title: Dated Hotel
review.reviewText: Old dated hotel no room to put away clothing bathroom sink would not drain.dreary. Exorbitant fee for parking . Would not go back there again

review.title: Another Meeting
review.reviewText: I send a lot of time in San Fran and this is one of my fav's when there for biz.
review.locationRemarks: walk to food, etc.

review.title: Due the renovation that is planned
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, with fantastic views of the city, if you get a room on level 10+. Impressive rooms but very much due a renovation just because they were very old and musty. The location is a bit out of downtown, but that's only because I am used to staying in Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: How high up in the city it is
review.negativeRemarks: Refurb on the rooms and furniture. Very small fitness room.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk down the hill to downtown, but a bit separate from everything else. Very close to the cathedral and next to The Fairmont, that's about it.

review.title: nice hotel but dated
review.reviewText: The check in was smooth and the facility was just ok. It is a little dated.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great if you want peace and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: I was given a room for a person with disabilities and I was not told that this would be the case.  The shower was therefore not appropriate.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to everything if you do not mind a steep hill--I did not. It was good exercise

review.title: It's about the location
review.reviewText: The valet staffs are very polite. Every one is professional. The room I got (standard) is not very special but ok.
Very rude staff and old hotel. I would never stay here again!

review.title: Excellent location for Sanfrancisco sight-seeing.
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance to North Beach (20 minutes), China Town (10 minutes), the Wharf (30 minutes), and Union Square (10 minutrs). Staff is friendly, professional and helpful.  Bed and linens are wonderful. Top of the Mark is great to visit for food or a drink.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location is great with beautiful views of the city from the Top of the Mark.
Beautiful hotel.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Amazing views.

Great room. Beautiful view.
I like being up on Nob Hill out of the crowds but walking distance to Union Square.
The staff was excellent.  We enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel.  Accomidations were eccellent

review.title: A First Class hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Just one night, but very nice indeed. I rarely stay in first class hotels, but wanted to splurge in San Francisco. Check in was quick and easy, as was parking. The beds were very comfortable, and the room was very quiet. Service was excellent. Cable cars passing by out the window. Room service for breakfast was quick and the food (and coffee) were great. All of it a bit pricey, but that's what I expected. This was the fifth day of a seven day trip, with lots of road time and stops in various motels, so a bit of luxury was a nice break. A very nice experience overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, of course. The Top of the Mark is just an elevator ride away. Great service, and nice amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: My only quibble is that the fan in the bathroom didn't seem to work. No bid deal.
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill! A cable car ride from Fisherman's Wharf, Market Street, Union Square, Chinatown is just a few blocks. The Tonga room is across the st

review.title: Sleeping next to the elevator
review.reviewText:
Hi,
Not sure by where to start. Went to this hotel 10 years ago in one of the suite. I remember as being class, warm, upscale.
It's over. We arrived around 7pm. I forgot my driving license and from there we were treated poorly. I had " I need to call my manager". I paid the hotel in advance, showed him 5 credit cards with my name on it. My friend had driving licenses, still it was a big deal. They asked me to see the reference in my emails. I had to pull my iPhone and search for the email. Clearly we didn't feel welcomed. At all.
We were 3, they put us in a 2 bed rooms. We imaging they would be queen beds, but no... Full beds. So we called and they changed us to a king bed and a rolling single bed... Next to the elevator.... Disaster.
clearly the hotel wasn't full, why on earth put us next to an elevator???
In the morning we called, we just wanted an extra pod for the coffee machine kreurig, because they were 2 and we were ...3. I called the housekeeping and she replied, that it was a room service item and then I will be charged, the coffee pod never arrived...
Of course, we had only 2 towels in the room, they never thought about adding one. 
The top of the mark was beautiful for the view, but super noisy inside, people in jean and baseball cap, while we were wearing cocktail dresses. Very rough. No table cloth, no class whatsoever. It killed my memories of my first arrive in San Francisco 10 years ago, very sad. :(

review.title: Room and hotel dirty and in poor condition
review.reviewText: Front desk manager was nice and upgraded our room after we asked him to come and see the condition of the room we were given. This was like it has not been cleaned for months! The upgraded room had a wonderful view on the city but cleanliness was average.
Had a good experience but the hotel is a bit shabby, needs painting and a redecorated lobby

review.title: Mark
review.reviewText: Awfull food!! Dirty carpets! Noisy a/c in room! There really isnt anything in this hotel that is up to par!! Location is good!
review.negativeRemarks:
Everything!
Everything is outdated!
Not woth the money!
review.locationRemarks: Shoping! Museums, stores and food near by!

review.title: Nice, comfortable, good service.
review.reviewText: I was in town for a meeting and spent little time in hotel.  Did use room service- which was excellent.
Great stay, friendly and welcoming staff. Fantastic breakfast buffet!

review.title: Tip Top of the Mark
review.reviewText: We had a great time staying at the hotel from the Valet to the Bellmen to the Concierge making everything easy and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to have a refrigerator not associated with a locked minibar. Also a mention of ice machines on alternate floors at checkin.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to Grace Cathedral and the children's playground the first night.  Then next day we walked to Sears and took a Cable Car to the Wharf.

review.title: Absolutely superb hospitality
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental for considerable duration in between moving out of my old apartment and the beginning of my lease at my new apartment. I can confidently say that I have never received as wonderful, unparalleled intimate customer service and hospitable accommodations as I did at the Mark Hopkins than at any other hotel I've ever stayed at. The staff are experts in their commitment to ensuring that your stay and comfort is at the top of their priority. From their patience to their attention to detail when making sure every expectation is exceeded during your visit, this hotel's awesome staff and the building's beautiful historic finishes are the essence of the quintessential definition of hospitality. 5 stars.
Loved this hotel!  Staff was very friendly.  Tha cappuccino was the best ever!
Very nice, beautiful.   Lobby furniture needs to be covered or replace.   A bit worn

review.title: Bidens hotel
review.reviewText: It seems that the Vice President likes to stay here. We were unfortunate enough to be there during his recent visit.  Secret Service and police everywhere. The elevators were packed. Delays getting your valet car from garage.  When we complained we were told it was out of their hands. Not a good stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Shut the hotel when Biden is in town!
review.locationRemarks: Good location. We did a lot of uber to get around. Easier than taking your own car.

review.reviewText: Taxi price from airport is meterd 50.00.Hotel said it would be about 25.00 not so.No hotel shuttle.Thought that odd.Beautiful hotel.Very up scale.Surprised the only ice machine was on 11th floor.Lovely view.Elegant venue.Top of the Mark a must to visit.Top floor.No cover charge for guests.

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a beatiful view and you can walk very close to the powell street and take a ride in the famouse tranv.

review.title: Business
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location.  I stayed on the 2nd floor which I was not a fan of. i can hear the trafffic and all the noise outside.   Prefer a higher floor.
review.negativeRemarks: $7 water bottles?  Ridiculous!!  Keurig machine didn't work and I never got the wine opener I requested when I called for it. :(
review.locationRemarks: My office was located near by.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel at crest of Nob Hill SF
review.reviewText: A room with a view at this historic hotel will make every visit special, and the staff and service are excellent.  I hope to return again soon!

review.title: Always wonderful
review.reviewText: Always a wonderful time at the Mark Hopkins! We loved drinks at the Top of the Mark

review.title: Needs revamping
review.reviewText: This used to be a beautiful hotel, as is obvious from the entrance. And it's a great location. But the rooms are shabby, service is unimpressive (doormen never bothered to open doors for me), and room service menu is so old school that there is nothing remotely healthy on it. No amenities - a motel I stayed in the night before in Palo Alto had way better amenities. At least there was coffee and tea in the room.... but the Expedia price was fair for San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service options.
review.locationRemarks: Amazing walking to union square

review.title: Needs to be renovated
review.reviewText: I have stayed at Mark Hopkins in the past and it used to be a good hotel and had really enjoyed my stay. But recently I returned back to Mark Hopkins after a few years only to be disappointed. The wooden doors were so old and chipped and the furniture completely outdated. There were no electric outlets next to the bed, which would make cell phone charging very inconvinient since I would set my alarm in my phone. There was no clock on the bed side table. Even the lamps on the bed side didn't have an electric outlet. The rooms seemed so ancient, inconvenient, and completely worn out. Will not be coming back to this one!

review.title: Great value for a Nob Hill Experience.
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at the Mark Hopkins Hotel.  My son and I were in the city for a mother/son adventure.   We found the staff to be polite, friendly and professional.  The atmosphere of the hotel is quiet, stately and elegant.  Nothing snobby about this place.  Great location for access to any part of the city.  Nob Hill graciously sits above the noise and congestion of Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: The Top of the Mark is a fun place.  My son and I went up there for a nightcap after our dinner at North Beach.  A live band was playing Motown hits.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Central to all areas of the city.  Beautiful views.  Above the noise.

review.reviewText: Hotel was satisfactory. The room and bathroom were a bit small but clean. Location was good and easily got taxi and/or uber cars. The hotel staff was OK, but I found the staff in the restaurant to be a little less hospitable than I'd expect.

review.title: Great views
review.reviewText: I booked the upgrade to a deluxe room which guarantees a higher floor. Mine was on the 11th floor and had very nice views across the city. The room  was spacious and well appointed. Bathroom was functional and nice looking, but on the smaller side.
review.negativeRemarks: The prices for room service and/or breakfast are too high, to the point where there is a price/value issue.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location as a basis for sightseeing.

review.title: Lovely, elegant hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is lovely, as are the staff members.  The lobby-level restaurant has awful food, although the wait-staff is top-notch.  My 4am requested wake-up call never arrived, so I'm glad that I also set my Iphone alarm, or I would've missed my flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant on lobby level.
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to Union Square to be convenient and far enough away to be quiet.

review.title: Mark Hopkins stay was very disappointing
review.reviewText: Not up to usual Intercontinental standards.  Room was quite small.  Front desk manager was rude.  Condition was deteriorating - one step from tatty.  Amenities were sparse. Bar upstairs not recommended, in spite of the view. I would not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs new management to update condition, replace staff, and change attitude.
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill.  Various fine hotels, theaters and churches nearby.

review.title: New years eve
review.reviewText:
Wonderful stay for NewYears eve !
Room was awesome with a wonderful view.
What more do i need to say.

review.title: The yellow curtain in the room was ugly.
review.reviewText: Staff super nice. Room condition ok. Better than a motel.

review.title: Great deal for the price and swanky area!
review.reviewText: We were treated like rock stars! It's the most beautifully decorated hotel for Christmas from the outside reefs and red carpet to the large Christmas tree inside!! We got an amazing room on the 15th floor overlooking the bay.  Just perfect!  I am in love with this place.  Will definitely stay again.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Very nice historic hotel. You can "feel"the history. The staff was extremely friendly.  A "must do" is to have drinks at the Top of the Mark in the evening. A little pricey but totally worth the view!  The cable car stops right outside the hotel. Great Italian food at the Nob Hill Cafe a couple blocks from the hotel.

review.title: Landmark hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were top notch. The bathroom was nice and roomy with a large corner room. I didn't like the cost of parking at the hotel; a whopping $54 a night....a bit excessive. The views at the Top of the Mark were amazing! Highly recommend.

review.title: Great hotel, best location in SF
review.reviewText:
I've been at this hotel before, and intend to stay there again, as it is a magnificent hotel, with a great breakfast brunch, and an exquisite (albeit expensive) Sunday brunch, and Top of the Mark is a wonderful spot to have a late drink, with brilliant views and great cocktails.

However, there is one exception to the above, and that is on Saturday night, when they make the Top of the Mark a "party spot" with louder music and an entrance fee.  I have no problem with the Hotel trying to find new ways to maximize the Top of the Mark's income, but as a paying guest, I was frankly offended being asked to have another fee just to go in and order a drink.  I was so ticked off, I left and went across the street to the Fairmount and had a couple of drinks there instead.  And I wasn't the only one, a couple who left the bar when I did followed me over to the Mark Hopkins and went up to their room as well.  I can't believe sending Hotel guests over to the Fairmount bar is what the Hopkin's management had in mind when they started their Saturday night policy.

So, one suggestion, management might want to set aside part of the Top of the Mark for paying guest who just want to enjoy their superb cocktails.
review.negativeRemarks: Note the above comment about reserving a part of the Top of the Mark for paying guests on Saturday night.
review.locationRemarks: Just about everything, shopping, architectural wonders, cable cars.

photos.caption: Looking down the hill from front entrance

review.title: Great weekend escape!!
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful, very friendly & helpful staff! Would highly recommend the Mark Hopkins. Located on top of Nob Hill. Amazing views from the room!

review.title: Nice hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent a week here for our honeymoon. It served as a great home base as we explored San Francisco and Napa Valley. The location is worthwhile if you don't mind walking up and down Nob Hill. It's clearly an older building, but it's been kept up very well and still looks great inside and out. Visiting the Top of the Mark lounge on the top floor is a must. We were very pleased with our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Well-kept, clean, courteous staff, great value.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great - it's a 15 min walk from Union Square and offers nice views atop Nob Hill. Walking up the steep Nob Hill can be rough though.

photos.caption: Easy access to and from hotel

review.title: Great old landmark hotel downtown SF
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff. Beautiful hotel.  We we given a room by the elevator and ice machine so a little noise.  Beautiful room otherwise

review.title: Great view but steep hills
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located in Nob Hill.  If your fit and open to walk up the steep hills to get to the hotel, then this place is for you.  
Wall paper from the restroom needs to be reinforced.
On a positive note, the hotel has a great view from The Top of the Mark.  No reservations accepted.  Get there early for a table.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a beautiful view!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Interconinental Mark Hopkins for three nights and loved it! The rooms were good sized and the views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz were amazing! Beds were super comfy and plenty of storage space in the bathrooms! Would definetly go back and recommend to friends!

review.title: Not what I reserved
review.reviewText: Went to SF for the Nike Women's Half Marathon. Made reservations months in advanced for 2 double beds. Did not receive them. Staff was condescending and rude.
Beautiful building. Nice rooms. Polite and attentive staff.  Really comfortable beds. It was a very good stay. Absolutely no complaints.

review.title: Stayed here many times...but something has changed
review.reviewText: This trip, we used Expedia points to "buy down" the cost of the room. This was the WORST room we've ever had...small, dark, chunks of wood gouged out of doors, bathroom really run down and so dark. Light bulbs burnt out and not replaced. I can't help but think they put us in the worst $400/night room they had, perhaps because we were using Expedia points. Top of the The Mark has always been run down, but this time it was mostly closed down for a private (corporate meeting) event three different times we tried to go there. We won't go back, and we typically stay there three to four times per year.
review.positiveRemarks: Bell staff is great. Location is perfect. We'll just try a different hotel next visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting, room size, upgrade/paint/put some lights in bathroom.

review.reviewText: Location, the staff, & the view from the top were amazing

review.title: Hotel staff was extremely friendly!
review.reviewText: I had a great time at the hotel.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Perfect location to get to the Nike half marathon starting line.  Staff had water and coffee ready early for all the runners.  Only down side was the price of parking.  Crazy high!!

review.title: Top of the Hill!
review.reviewText: Mark Hopkins sits on top of Knob Hill in San Francisco and certainly not for the faint hearted as it is a steep climb! Staff are very friendly and helpful but the room and décor look a little tired. The meals we had there were very good but expensive,service good. Too few lifts in the lobby for the amount of people staying there is a concern.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: The general look and feel of the rooms is tired but very clean. Also include tea & coffee in the hotel or possibly the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Union Square simply walk down the hill.There's the Italian and Chinese quarters close by for eating out, the cable cars & Alcatraz a must or Napa wine

review.title: Hotel was close to cable car tracks for ease
review.reviewText: everyone was very kind to us.  Especially the doormen.

review.title: Comfortable old world classic hotel
review.reviewText: Easy check in, quiet spacious room, excellent bedding, friendly staff , lovely old world hospitality and comfort

review.title: Great location in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Skip the buffet breakfast. Overpriced and not that great. Service was poor in the dining room as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Buffet breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, easy walk to the Embarcadero and on to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice place to stay on Nob Hill, out of the fray
review.reviewText: I liked staying on Nob Hill. It was easy access to 101 and 280 and nice to be away from the fray of SOMA, especially during the big tech conferences. Very nice staff -- very responsive and nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Top of the Mark is always a fun hang out! Good restaurants closeby on Russian Hill.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows and towels.

review.title: We were disappointed in the location
review.reviewText: There was no gift shop; the business center was located in the lobby with many people around and when one considers what we were paying for our very ordinary room, it seemed rather 'petty' to charge even a nominal amount for short use of the computer and to print our airline boarding passes?  Also -- we felt there was an exhorbitant charge per day to log in to Wi-Fi - despite the fact that in hotel literature it represented 'free' Wi-Fi...when questioned, the desk clerk did say that it would be complimentary if one was a member of the Inter-Continental 'Club' (free to join - which we did).  There were no restaurants in close proximity...and the hotel restaurant did not offer any choice for breakfast other than their buffet (no menu ordering)....and the hotel's location (on top of hill) was not conducive to walking - at least 'up' the hill very many times thus requiring either a cab or cable car.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much....we would not stay here again.

review.title: Disappointing Stay at the Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText:
My husband and I booked a 2 night stay at the Mark Hopkins that included breakfast. The price we chose on Expedia only referred to the first night. The second night was much more--over $100 difference. We were not informed about that until we got the bill. As noted above, we also signed up for breakfast. The first morning we enjoyed it and looked forward to the second breakfast, especially because we had an early flight out of San Francisco and a long, traveling day ahead of us. That's when we found out that breakfast started serving at 6:30am. We had to leave the hotel at 6am to catch our flight on time. So, because room service didn't allow for a hot breakfast until 6:30am, we missed breakfast all together. This was very disappointed because we paid for it.

There was no mention of breakfast times from Expedia. If that had been mentioned, we wouldn't have signed up for breakfast on both days.

This was a disappointing adventure into San Francisco......

review.title: Nice hotel , good location
review.reviewText: Was a nice place.  Not sure if I would say it was worth the price.  It's beautiful on the outside and the location is decent, but the rooms were nothing special.  Was a basic room.  Beds and linens were comfortable.  You definitely pay for the name.

review.title: Historic Stay
review.reviewText: In addition to the wonderful all round hotel and its staff, we liked the added aspect of learning the historic significance of the immediate area. It accounts for the term hob knobing, something I would likely never have known had I not stayed there.

review.title: Excellent Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff of this hotel cannot be beaten for hospitality, friendliness and attentiveness. Everyone was wonderful! The hotel itself is a classic gem - very traditional, wonderful location and classy. If you're looking for modern, this is not your hotel though it is very well maintained, clean and comfortable. It is pricey, but the quality and excellent service justify the cost.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, particularly its excellent staff, large rooms, history and elegance.
review.negativeRemarks: The windows are single pane and allow quite a bit of traffic sound to get through. Fortunately, the street quiets down at night.
review.locationRemarks: The "Top of the Mark" restaurant and bar has incredible views. A cable car stop is nearby. Walking is quite requires some steep climbs, but is fun.

review.title: Nice location, walking distance to many locations.
review.reviewText: The front desk and bell staff were excellent. We were able to walk from hotel to most areas but cable cars ae very close if preferred. Cab service was prompt when needed and managed well by the bellmen.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to downtown Union Square, AT$T ballpark, Chinatown, North Beach, and Fisherman's Wharf areas.  Cable cars run very close to hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel however walking is difficult
review.reviewText: Excellent room comfort but location not the best view of SF for price.

review.title: Grand old hotel !
review.reviewText: Great historic hotel in key location. Check in staff could be a little more friendly.

review.title: A Grand Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Mark Hopkins is clearly a grand hotel. 

The staff are pleasant, well trained professionals who attend to every detail. 

I look forward to my next visit.

review.title: Outdated, noisy!!
review.reviewText: Stayed in three hotels on my recent trip to this area. This hotel is old and outdated!  The street noise was unbearable and noise from hallway was unacceptable!  I would not stay here again!

review.title: Excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: Nearby all the best restaurants and great place on Top of the Mark! Classy and reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Allow guest to reserve upstairs. Lots of others arrive and hotel guests have to wait to get in the Top of the Mark
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and great restaurants

review.title: Top of Nob HIll..
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Mark Hopkins before and I'd say the rooms are nothing special; adequate but not luxurious by any means.  They could do better in the little things.  For example, most 4 star and 5 star hotels give a free bottle of water, not charge 6 or 7 dollars for one... that's so low end...  We've stayed very recently at the Grand Del Mar, the 4 Seasons Biltmore in Santa Barbara, and other places and none of them charge for water and in fact, make sure you have more than enough free bottles.  So, this is a turn off to us...
review.positiveRemarks: The Breakfast on Sunday mornings is lovely.  The room is not very pretty...  Probably would stay at The Palace next time.
review.negativeRemarks: See above about the water, maybe a mint with turn down service at night..  Your hotel is the bare minimum unless you're in the special club you have..
review.locationRemarks: It's SF... lots to do and cable car is close by to go down the hill to shopping in Union Square or to the Wharf.

review.title: Nice Hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Mark Hopkins, enjoyed it as its wants to be a very swanky hotel. But the dust around the door frames, no wifi and uncomfortable bed and pillows makes it from swanky to a wannabe swanky hotel.

Perhaps it's time for them to update some of the facilities to warrant the cost of the rooms?

I got there a little early for check in. Room not ready .no problem had drink in lounge while I waited. Room still wasn't ready by 3.45. Only was staying for one night. That was only problem. Very nice otherwise.

review.title: Perfectly-located classic hotel
review.reviewText: The Mark Hopkins is the gold standard when it comes to customer experience. This hotel does not disappoint. The staff is warm and gracious and the service level is set very high. And the location....can't be beat. Gorgeous old-world property with great amenities and address.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, rooms, bathrooms, location, Top of the Mark
review.negativeRemarks: the lobby feels a little shabby when compared to its neighbor, the Fairmont. Top of the Mark furniture and decor could use an ugprade
review.locationRemarks: So much! Perfect location at the top of Nob Hill

review.title: Right in the heart of San Francisco, Grace Cathedr
review.reviewText: Excellent! Enjoyed the friendly staff and location
review.negativeRemarks: Guest should receive discount for breakfast

review.title: Stressfull time for front desk
review.reviewText: The computer system went down on the day of our arrival and didn't come back up that day. As we attempted to check in a number of times during the day you could see it was telling on the staff.  By the evening with me and check to see the front desk was terse and abrupt. This was notable more so because it was the single time during the entire stay we had a poor interaction with any of this outstanding and invested crew.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Birthday celebration with my mother, daughter and 2 young grandsons.

review.title: Good location, on cable car track
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were very polite, allowed us to register before noted checkin time and valet parked the car until we left the next day. Driving directions out of city to Oakland Bay bridge were very easy to follow. Our hotel was very close to the Huntington where our Michigan friends were staying, so it made it very convenient for all of us. Our room was nice, but our view was not the best. That didn't matter too much since we were out and about most of the time anyway.

Hotel is beautiful.  Very well maintained, the rooms are a decent size.  My biggest complaint is that there was literally a charge for everything.  I had to pay $10.95 to get online to print shuttle tickets to the airport and that doesn't even include the per page printing.  Over $14 a night for Wifi.  It's a beautiful hotel, Top of the Mark is gorgeous, and it's a very comfortable space otherwise.
review.positiveRemarks: Look and feel is great.  The Top of the Mark is beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wifi. Or at least cheaper.  Free use of the business center to print a few things. Perhaps 5 minutes free.

review.reviewText: Great hotel in SF. Intend to stay there again during our next visit. Concierge was extremely helpful.

photos.caption: View from Top of Mark on 18th floor

review.title: nice hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Definitely go to top of Mark on 18th floor. Breakfast is expensive. Had a nice view from our room over Nob Hill

review.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever.
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and helpful, the service is top notch.  The location can't be beat.  The bar, the Top of the Mark, is iconic.  Truly a once in a lifetime experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Nicely appointed, roomy, outstanding service, friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Landmark hotel & Ideal location
review.reviewText: I checked in late at 9pm and was upgraded to executive room on 16th floor with great view, huge bath room, king size bed and sitting area. Room was well appointed and clean. Reward club members get free access to wi fi , another plus. Staff & concierge desk were very polite, helpful  and very accommodating.  They have facility to hold your bags after check out which is nice too!
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Ideal location i.e. close to shopping, financial district, China town etc. Easily accessible via all public transportation!
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel is great from outside but needs refurbishing from inside to make it even great!

review.reviewText: Nice hotel and location, Staff was very responsive.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, not so good service
review.reviewText:
Service was very slow checking in.  I had to wait an extra 2 hours as they couldn't seem to get that room ready.  They ended up having to give me another room.  But, that part was OK because it had a better view.

We went to the top of the Mark in the evening.  I was dressed up in a nice outfit, color coordinated and stylish, with a hat that matched as well.  I wear a hat since a medical situation caused my hair to fall out.  As we waited for a table, the lady seating people never mentioned my hat.  Finally, when it was our turn to be seated, as we're passing by the bouncer, the lady says "I'm going to have to ask you to remove your hat.  I said "What?"  I told her my hair had fallen out and I couldn't take it off without embarrassment.  She wouldn't let me in until the bouncer said "It's OK, let her in."  As she took us to our table, I mentioned that the Queen of England always wears hats and they are considered quite stylish.  She said "Well, if you don't follow the rules, others may complain".  Please, no one complained!  They obviously don't teach their employees to be kind to people with physical disabilities.  I was sad to be treated this way.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor and the downstairs lobby restaurant, food and service.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in service could be more efficient, more friendly and welcoming.  Service at the Top of the Mark could be much more friendly and efficient.
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill.  Not too far from Chinatown.

review.title: Nice Hotel but Lousy AC
review.reviewText: The InterContinental Mark Hopkins is a beautiful hotel in a great location and very nice staff but the AC in the room was lousy!!!  We had the Maintenance Person come up and change the AC Filter and said he fixed it but it was very stuffy and uncomfortable in our room..
review.negativeRemarks: Air Conditioning (AC)

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: overall excellent, beds too soft for our taste, would be nice if adjustable or not as soft,  but otherwise all was lovely
review.positiveRemarks: location, ambience, ease of getting to and from all other sites we enjoyed.

review.reviewText: Good location.close to all major sight seeing spots.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable beds! We will stay again if we come back to San Fran.
Trainee wasn't very friendly but rest of staff was very friendly. Bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Location is not comfortable. Breakfast is very exp
review.reviewText: Did meet my expectations and the room did not include breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel at great location
review.reviewText: Great comfortable bed, mattress and pillows. Very responsive staff. Bedside lamp was broken, and replaced within minutes. However, quite noisy in the morning (street noise).
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness (don't look behind your bed looking for an outlet, you'll be horrified by the dust balls).; sound proof windows

review.title: Very nice, but noisy.
review.reviewText: When we first checked in, we had a room on the fourth floor.  The noise from the cable car and the parking plaza in front of the hotel wasn't too bad.  However, the next morning, the guests (and their children) in the room adjoining ours were up at 7:00.  We knew this because we could hear every word.  The rooms were connecting and the doors must have made of wafer-thin cardboard.  We contacted the front desk and were transferred to a somewhat smaller room on the 15th floor, along with a bottle of prosecco - very nice touch.  We enjoyed the remainder of our stay.

review.title: Great location/view
review.reviewText: Top of the Mark is a great place to check out while you are here - one of the better views in SFO. Staff was great - polite and congenial. Check in and check out literally took a few minutes total - very efficient. Room was nice. Only comment about the room was that the shower water vacillated between full hot and full cold. We've all had experiences where the temperature varies, but this was from one extreme to the other. You couldn't take a shower under the head - had to move in and out of the stream to rinse off. That was the only ding in their armor that we could tell. Would otherwise stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing needs some help.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a quick walk. The trolley stop is literally in front of the hotel

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, great bar at the top of the hotel!

review.title: Grand old Hotel
review.reviewText: I always love staying here for sentimental reasons. Bathrooms need upgrading but a great staff!
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Business and close to Chinatown etc

review.title: Terrific Experience
review.reviewText: The location, history, interior and exterior esthetics, the view, the room itself were all wonderful. And the staff was both friendly and quick to address any question or concern. We even loved walking up and down the hill as we explored the area around the Hopkins.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, AT&T Park, the Embarcadero --so much to see and do is within walking distance.

review.title: Overnight Stay by Locals
review.reviewText: My wife wanted to attend a display at the DeYoung Museum the next day so rather than fighting commute traffic in the morning we decided to stay at the Mark Hopkins the prior evening.  We had never stayed there before.  Very elegant hotel.  All the staff (including the person who parked and returned our car) were very friendly.  The first room was by the elevator but the hotel staff was able to find us another room some distance away without a great deal of trouble.  Room was large and well appointed.  It was very quiet at night.  Although the hotel is definitely pricey, we will definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: The Top of the Mark is a San Francisco icon that should not be missed.  Skies were clear and views were spectacular.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast had only buffet available and for light eaters like us, it rarely is worth the price.  Would prefer to order off a menu.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is within reasonable walking distance of Union Square (shopping) and the financial district (business and many restaurants).

review.title: Top of the world, middle of everything.
review.reviewText: Overall experience was excellent.  Only drawback, was Joe Biden happened to be arriving and staying here the same day we were.  Motorcades, road closures and secret service packed elevators, made our stay a little less relaxing than what we hoped.  Other than that, oh and ridiculously priced parking!!!  Everything else was wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: Access for guests should not be restricted when there's a public figure staying at the hotel as well.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants, shopping and a doggie park right across the street, make this location perfect for a visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Intercontinental Mark Hopkins Thee Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: We had a corner room with great views of the city. It is at the top of Nob Hill. We loved everything about our room. It was very well appointed, is a good size with a comfortable arm chair for reading. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the best we have ever had.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, beautiful room, arm chair for reading, comfortable Bed, great showers
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was very expensive, the most I have ever paid.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to AT&T Ball Park (454 Min), Fisherman's wharf (45 Min), Cable Car Museum (15 Min)

review.title: Happy But Hungry
review.reviewText:
Overall, I had a very positive experience at the InterContinental - Mark Hopkins.  Beautiful hotel, great views, extremely friendly staff.  The only thing that I found to be a bit disconcerting was that fact that brunch was "sold out" on Sunday morning.  Granted is was Easter Sunday, but I think it would have been nice if the hours that brunch were served were extended until ALL of the hotel guests were able to dine.  

I'd certainly recommend this hotel to friends or family.
review.locationRemarks: Located at the top of Nob Hill...next to cable cars, cathedral, quiet park.  Walking distance to Union Square and Financial District.

review.reviewText: The hotel was nice n the staff was friendly. The hotel needs a face lift/renovations ASAP! As it shows it age.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText:
This was our first family trip to San Francisco and we were so happy we chose to stay at the 
Mark Hopkins Intercontinental.  It was close to shopping, restaurants, Chinatown and the views from Top of the Mark were unbelievable.  We were right near several cable car stops so we parked our car and only used it once the rest of the trip.  We would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have a little store/gift shop in the hotel for incidentals.
review.locationRemarks: Although we could've taken cable cars, most of the time we walked to Chinatown, Grace Cathedral and Union Square.

review.title: Comfy bed but...
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed but bathroom very small for 2 adults (about 5' x 5').  There was very little shelving or space for toiletries and personal grooming items.  Rather noisy on the cable car line -- could use insulated windows.
review.positiveRemarks: Fairly easy to get around, i.e., walking distance to a lot of attractions, cable car outside door, very quick taxi service.
review.negativeRemarks: Re-do and expand bathrooms or at least include more storage.  Insulate windows for street noise from cable car line.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car line right outside door.  Walking distance to Chinatown & Union Square.

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Over priced small room looking at air conditioner horrible view

review.title: Beautiful Architecture and views!!
review.reviewText: Found a great price on Expedia!!  Beautiful hotel at the top of nob hill.  Great view from our room on the 7th floor and spectacular views from the Top of the Mark Bar.  Great live band Friday night, delicious drinks, fair prices and great service!!

review.title: Great hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: I'm about to give the highest recommendation there is, I'm about to rebook another trip there!
review.positiveRemarks: Food, location, drinks, views, just about everthing.
review.negativeRemarks: I realize Top of the Mark can be crowded, but they could be friendlier to frequent guests.

review.title: Comfy Beds
review.reviewText:
Most comfortable beds.  The staff was excellent.  Even sent me a free bottle of champagne for my birthday.  
Wonderful stay. Top of the Mark is wonderful
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and the staff and the views
review.negativeRemarks: They should have a regular breakfast instead of just a buffet.
review.locationRemarks: It is away from everything and is very quite. Which was nice for us.

review.reviewText: Great experience, will come back again!  Everyone was wonderful!

review.title: Nice Hotel with Excellent Service
review.reviewText: We stayed for my wife's birthday and they went above and beyond to make it unforgettable! The staff was amazing and very helpful. Will be staying there from now one when we come to visit
review.positiveRemarks: Everything from the appearance to the staff to the amazing views from our hotel and at the Top of the Mark
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a little bit more space in restroom but it was really easy to manage for two people
review.locationRemarks: Location was awesome and there are numerous things to do within walking distance

review.title: Grand hotel but bell staff not so attentive
review.reviewText: Grand hotel and I would definitely stay again. Great location

review.title: Great location, nice historic hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is very nice, well maintained , and in an excellent location. Our room faced a messy rooftop under construction, but I suppose that can't always be prevented. The beds were comfortable with good quality linens (very important to me!). The Top of the Mark bar on the top floor of the hotel was a fun place to visit, with great live music. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, but seemed to be in training and made quite a few errors (which were corrected promptly) in our checkin, checkout, bill paying etc.
review.negativeRemarks: vent in bathroom would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: great views of city, walked to chinatown (5 min), financial district (5 min), wharf (about 30 min), and ferry bldg (15 min). cable car right out door.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
I paid for a room for three with breakfast while check in reception staff told me breakfast is for 2 only 
The bed was not comfortable 
The bathroom was very small

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText: We were at the intercontinental for more of a nap than an overnight stay and the stay was impeccably accommodating.  Even to the point to alert me that all of the empty parking spaces across the street were normally 2hr parking but since it was a holiday the next day,(MLK) that I could park on the street and not be towed.( saved me $64). So nice and warm hospitality.  Wish that there was more of this out there. They were genuinely concerned about the comfort of our stay. fantastic.  Highly recommended.

review.title: did not spend much time in room but city was great
review.reviewText: enjoyed my time .Brought my sun down for his graduating gift and went on a food tour
review.positiveRemarks: Good location and great font door and garage staff

review.reviewText: Everyone was very helpful and professional. We felt a bit spoiled, but in a good way.

Great location on the top of Nob Hill. Close to Chinatown and walking distance (downhill) to Union Square. Definitely need a cab or cable car to be back up...
The room was great with a nice view, room service breakfast was delicious. Our only complaint would be waiting in line to get to our room at 5:00 since the elevators also service the Top of the Mark. Overall a great place to stay!

review.title: it was like sleeping on the pavement
review.reviewText: The hotel was pricey upwards of $750/night. The room was noisy, as the walls were thin- cable car right outside and a busy street. I could clearly hear the woman next door talking on her phone. The maid kept opening the windows making the room freezing. The glass panes were not well insulated and one could feel the coldness and drafts coming through. At the breakfast buffet, there were small ants crawling on the strawberries. The bathroom was tiny that I had no place to put my toiletries. The shower had no cold water- just hot and hotter. For $750/night, I would expect a whole lot more. The room was dated. The hotel is very old and dated.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything needs to be improved

review.title: Upscale hotel on Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: Right next to a cable car stop.  Once I determined the routes of the various cable cars, tolleys, and buses getting to/from hotel and around SF was easy.  The Top of the Mark was a singular experience.  The 360 degree view is breath taking.  Reference to the soldiers, sailors, and airmen departing from SF with a farewell goodbye/drink from loved ones at the Top of Mark was hearfelt.  Front desk staff, bell staff, housekeeping staff were all polite, friendly and professional. But huge kudos go to the concierge staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Renew the bathroom towels, please.
review.locationRemarks: Hop on a cable car right in front of the hotel and with an all day pass see as little or as much as you're interested in.

review.title: Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: I was there two days and spent time doing work from my room which was well set up for that.

review.title: Classic hotel!!
review.reviewText: I was concerned about some of the negative reviews before deciding to stay here. I'm glad I did not listen to the negative reviews. The room was wonderful. The hotel was wonderful. The staff was fabulous! Can't wait to return!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Viewed several hotels before deciding on this one. Definitely one of the best hotels in San Francisco. Beautiful hotel with luxury old world charm.

review.title: Great location, great hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff was pleasant, polite and efficient.  The room was very comfortable with a good view.  The hotel is a classic.  I chose it for it's excellent location.  I look forward to staying there again.

review.title: Best location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I've been to San Francisco 4 times before, but this hotel made the difference of the whole city experience, being so well located.
review.negativeRemarks: I had a business meeting and we had nowhere to go within the hotel. The bar on the top floor was full, and we had to leave and go to another hotel. So

review.title: Visiting friends at the holidays
review.reviewText: Check in seamless. After seeing our third floor room check in clerk found us a better room-really spent time on finding us the best possible view. Housekeeper was so friendly. Had to go back for my charger-she had already set it aside. Just a great experience. Will be back next year!!

review.title: Gorgeous hotel with all modern convenience
review.reviewText: Great view but it's a hike up Nob Hill If you're a city walker. Took a taxi to airport because we couldn't imagine rolling heavy suitcases down those steep hills to BART!

review.title: Top of Nob Hill.  Can't beat the view.  old world
review.reviewText: Stayed right after Christmas and loved walking up the hill where the cable car runs
review.negativeRemarks: packed.  Top of the Mark too crowded
review.locationRemarks: The City Guide Tours in S.F. are wonderful.

review.reviewText: My husband wanted to stay at the Mark Hopkins because on his previous trips to San Fran., he had been told that it was very nice upscale hotel. That was not the case on our stay, The one elevator at the hotel was not working  most of our stay .We had a room on the 4 th floor and there was no public steps to get to our floor except for the ER exit steps. The hotel has bar (TOP of Mark) located at the top of the hotel. When the bar was open - the public would use  one of the 2 remaining working elevators to get to the bar. Therefore, the guest of the hotel had only one elevator to use. We would have to wait for some time for an elevator to leave or enter our floor. At times we were forced to use the ER exit steps. We did contact the staff 2-3 times  about the elevator problem, but the hotel staff  did not appear concerned about the problem or care if the elevator was not working . Also the lobby at the hotel was small, People going to Top the Mark would  fill the lobby and as guest  you really could not  use the lobby. The room we had was to be deluxe room but was small.
review.positiveRemarks: The housekeeper or maid was very good. She kept our room very clean .
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was on Nob Hill in San Fran, The hotel is located on Cable car line- California and Powell. The hotel is close to Chinatown,

review.reviewText: A lovely hotel in the heart of the City. Great views above the 10th floor. Our room was surprisingly spacious.

review.title: Tired and busy
review.reviewText: Great location.  Old hotel that is showing its age.  Parking is $61 per night which they didn't inform me about when parking the car.  Rental car was only $41 per night so it cost more to park than the rent the car.  Walls are thin.  I felt like I was in an adult movie with the people next door.  Rooms are tired, need a facelift.  Usually have to wait for the elevator with all the people going to the Top of the Mark.  750ml Evian bottles in the room for $8.50.  If you are going to charge that much, don't even put a bottle in the room as its offensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms

review.title: My Holiday getaway
review.reviewText:
I am very pleased to say I enjoyed my stay at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental Hotel.
I usually stay across the street at the Fairmont Hotel on top of Nob Hill. Now I can consider another alternate when I decide to visit San Francisco. I had a slight problem the first night there with water coming through the bathroom light fixture. The Front Manager David Valencia had taken care of the problem right away, by assigning me to a room comparable to the same one I had.

He sent a letter of apology for the mishap and ordered a bottle of wine along with a sample tray of appetizers cheeses, fruit and nuts to me. I appreciated the complement letter along with the attention to the matter.
review.positiveRemarks: The most of the staff members were nice. My room was clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: You can't have it any better than being on Nob Hill. The view is something to die for.

review.title: Hostile service
review.reviewText: Treated badly at breakfast as we only ordered coffee. Forced from our table, so we left. $200 remains on our Visa account two days after we paid our bill in full

review.title: Unprofessional Bellman
review.reviewText: We asked for an adaptor and the bellman gave me an "universal" adaptor that is absolutely not "universal", had to call the concierge again to ask for one, the bellman came back like he was in hell with the most unpleasing face ever! he's uniform was dirty also.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was so small!

review.title: lovely old hotel
review.reviewText: lovely old hotel with beautiful views from the "Top of the Mark"  Next year at Thanksgiving we will try their buffet, our stay was very pleasant, staff welcoming and courteous, bed comfortable, will stay there whenever in San Fran.

review.title: Complete unmitigated disaster.
review.reviewText: Their "system" was down, so they could not check anyone one in. They sent everyone to the lobby bar where they offered free drinks, which was nice. But we were there as a surprise party for our Dad, who was also waiting in the lobby bar, so we had to hide elsewhere until rooms were ready at 5pm and later. Rooms were so loud, so much noise from all sides, that I thought I was in a fraternity house. There was NO staff in the garage so I had to park my car by myself, and retrieve it, but they still charged me the same $60 that usually includes valet. Terrible staffing and technology situation at a historic hotel, what a shame!
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything.

review.title: Classic elegant SF hotel, rich with history
review.reviewText:
Spent the night there because we had a dinner event in the City, and had always wanted to stay there but never had a reason to as we live nearby.  Check in went fine, and though at first we were told they could not give us an upgrade (we had booked through Expedia standard room), when she saw that it was my birthday she put us in a deluxe...which I think was simply a higher floor, but much appreciated, as view of Nob Hill neighborhood was lovely.  Room was traditional and "old school SF", as were the lobby etc downstairs, which is just what we were hoping for.  Went upstairs to Top of the Mark for cocktail before leaving for our dinner event---that was lovely!  At first they told us we would have to wait 20 mins for a window table and stuck us somewhere crummy, but once they saw me get up and walk around and see several open window tables, they moved us before I could even ask.  Everything was fine after that.

The room was fine, service good, and when we called down at midnite to tell them there was no tv remote control in the room (Hmmm?), they came right up with a replacement.  Parking is pricey ($60) so we used the one right across the street ($42) and taxi'd to our event...still saved $! 

Location is wonderful--we took cable car to Union Square for breakfast at Sears Fine Foods, another old SF classic, and walked back up the hill and walked around and saw lots of lovely old places on Nob Hill--a great way to enjoy SF overnite if you are a local!
review.positiveRemarks: Classic, charming elegant without being phony, pretentious or stuffy. Great location, view, history and tradition.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger, thicker bath towels--they were very flimsy for a hotel of this quality
review.locationRemarks: Lots of SF historical buildings right nearby on Nob Hill, 2 different cable car lines that will take you to lots of neat places in SF

review.title: Enjoyed the hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, pretty lobbby nice restaurant.  Restaurant/parking pretty pricey though!
Beautiful hotel in a prime location.  Easy access to Chinatown, Union Square, and the Wharf.

review.title: "Kinda historic" doesn't imply bad condition
review.reviewText: Absolutely wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone,except if they really have to and out of any other option.I'm a constant traveller & have seen a lot around the world and not so picky or biased even toward my favorite hotels. I'm a Fairmont guest whenever in SF usually,but had to stay here because it was somebody else's choice.I felt good since it's an IC group hotel anyway&by default it should be good.Well, this particular one at least isn't.I was disappointed since I first stepped into the lobby but it was ok.Front desk's demeanor was very cold,plastic&impersonal.The biggest surprise was awaiting me once I got into my standard double bed room,I really instantly regretted every penny I paid & was determined to just get out of the room, get down to the front desk and confirm if this is their regular standard rooms&if so I'd just refund if possible&if not will just cross the street to the Fairmont.I was genuinely upset.All this scenario didn't happen because my travel partner convinced me that we're just gonna sleep now for about 8 hours&will leave the whole building by then.He was right after all,&I too that & just slept in disgust.Again I'm not picky¬ difficult to please at all, but it felt like a true trap.It didn't feel actually to me,it was a true zero value for the cost.Double checked with the front desk before leaving if this their standard double room,not old one or if they're renovating some & I didnt get that,she confirmed yes.Im wasting my time writing this now
review.negativeRemarks: Everything need serious intervention
review.locationRemarks: Location is hands down is superb and the only best part, and that has nothing to do with the building itself.

review.title: San Francisco ladies trip
review.reviewText: We moved once because the bathroom was way to small for 2 ladies. The second room we had was better, but there wasn't any drawer space or enough hangers or shelf space in the bathroom. We set up both ironing boards on which to place our things. The room never got under 74* the entire time we were there. Maintenance came immediately when we called and told us to close the curtains to keep out the sun and that they would override the system. It did come down from 77* , but never got lower than 74. We didn't want to move for a second time.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very nice and the staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: More food options would be nice. There were no appetizers available on the lobby level and nowhere to order anything for breakfast. Buffet only.
review.locationRemarks: Had to take a cab everywhere. Not much do do nearby.Jud

review.title: Mark Hopkins SF
review.reviewText: Great location on cable car route and historic area. Safe to walk around at night. Check in and out was quick.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic itself, historic area, very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Cable car rides and transfers to warf and downtown, china town a walk a way, art galleries and Union square close enough to walk to.

review.reviewText: beautiful hotel in a great location. staff is very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Beautiful classic San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed eight nights.  Staff was superb, helped is with everything.  They even gave us a couple of rides in the hotel courtesy vehicle for free.  Top of the Mark was a great place to view the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Buffet breakfast was excellent but on the expensive side.  Likewise the Top of the Mark Bar, cocktails were $14.
review.locationRemarks: Location on Nob Hill is a bit away from downtown, but you can walk there (wouldn't want to walk back up the hill though!)

review.title: Historic hotel with disappointing service.
review.reviewText: Zombies. That's our opinion of the staff at the InterContinental. For the price of this hotel you'd be way better off going directly across the street to the Fairmont. They treat their guests with class.
review.negativeRemarks: Service staff should be trained to care about guests especially considering the cost per night per room.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty to do, just don't ask the front desk...they don't know San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Great hotel, beautiful views of the entire city and a very helpful staff.  It was a first class experience.

review.title: amazing location for sure. Look out for the hills!
review.reviewText: Amazing trip to San Francisco. This hotel is where you want to be. Right in the heart of everything including the cable cars. 5-10 blocks away from everything.
review.positiveRemarks: the history for sure was amazing. Must go to the Top of the Mark.
review.negativeRemarks: Showers were weak. It would have been nice to see complimentary water/coffee in the lobby especially after walking up and down the streets of Nob Hill

review.title: Room location - Conceigere
review.reviewText:
Room was big but next to elevator whick was noisy especially early mornings and during "happy hour" at Top of The Mark.  

It took 3 tries to get 2 room keys that worked.

The one concierge (George) was very helpful with directions, dinner reservations,and  tickets but other one (a lady w/o a name tag) sent us to an "upscale ... popular ...  Nob Hill "special" steak / seafood restaurant but we we arrived for our 8 pm Friday night (!) reservation there was no one in the bar and only 5 tables filled with diners!?!  It really felt like we were sent to the "kick back" restaurant.  We left to eat else where.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly Doorman (great sense of humor and remembered us every time (!) we crossed paths with him!  And the bell stall was very friendly and help
review.locationRemarks: Great setting but had to take a cab or cable car to get to pretty much everything.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The staff was most helpful, most friendly. They made our say very enjoyable.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: On Nob Hill, so vert centrally located.

review.title: Try somewhere else !
review.reviewText: Although it's a good location the MH Int. has poor plumbing , unfriendly service and high prices to boot ($6.50 water). If you bring your car it's awkward. I don't recommend it

review.title: Comfortable hotel in nice neighborhood
review.reviewText: Decent sized room with a large, clean bathroom.  Great views from atop the hill, and some beautiful buildings around make the area look very nice.  It's quite a climb to get to the hotel from BART (streetcar runs by hotel), and the wind makes it chilly outside the hotel.

review.title: Great views!
review.reviewText: The rooms are well-maintained if a little dated, which somehow seems appropriate for Nob Hill.  The staff, as you would expect, is uniformally excellent, combining old-style formality with genuine concern.  No surprises here.
review.negativeRemarks: Short of a multi-multi-million dollar refurbishment, nothing
review.locationRemarks: You can't walk anywhere unless you are a mountain climber,, so it's cabs (always available), Uber, or a big choice of cable cars.  Come for the views.

review.title: Very relaxing great view
review.reviewText: The lady at the desk that checked us in was very friendly and helpful . Would be planning on going back soon .

review.title: Historic in too many ways
review.reviewText:
Good points:  I was able to book a deluxe king room at well below the SF market rate, and when we arrived they were out of deluxe king rooms so upgraded us to an executive room. Thus, we started out great - incredible price for a 4 star hotel in a great location - plus an upgraded room.   The service staff is impeccable, they treat you like a king.   

However, disappointment reigned after.  I had to move the bed to get to an electrical outlet.   I was horrified.  Dirt and massive amounts of hair were on the carpet and baseboard behind the bed.  It probably hasn't been moved since it was installed.  On my night table was a bose sound system which is a nice touch.  However, the unit is huge and it is bolted to the night table!  For a 4 star hotel it seems awkward and insulting. For a $300  per night hotel, they should treat their guests with more dignity than assuming they will steal a $150 alarm clock.  It made me feel cheap.

While the bed was very comfortable, the rest of the room was old and worn out.  The couch and chairs in the room were worn out, the arms were almost bare from use.   Last, the elevator experience is not fun.  They have only three for a large hotel, and they are old school small.   If you are on a middle floor, it is very difficult to get on the elevator.  The issue stems from their penthouse bar, it is a tourist trap that eats up elevator usage.

All in all, the room issues made the hotel stay unacceptable.

review.title: Classic San Fran!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! It is very old & classic but remodeled nicely. The entire staff was so helpful and friendly.  We brought our youg daughter and it was just fine for her. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful. Beds nice and rooms very clean. Bathrooms small but we didn't mind that. Great views and location.  We had a nice time.

review.title: honeymoon delight
review.reviewText:
This was a special event for us .
And the staff made it so . A bottle of wine and glasses awaited us . The staff made sure we we about to get around and enjoy San Fransisco .
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was what you would expect for an historic landmark , but was clean and beautiful . The restaurant had a great view of the city .

review.title: Nice view but beware of the serious climbs!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a nice entrance. It's fancy and also at the very top of NOB Hill! You'll surely have some strong legs by the time you make it up to the top! Service was great and consistent with a hotel of this rating. The rooms were nice and well maintained. The water pressure of the shower left much to be desired. The beds were comfortable as were the pillows. I liked that they have complimentary shoe shine service. I typically don't have housekeeping clean my room each day as I personally feel it to be unnecessary and can cause me allergic reactions to the dust or something kicked up by their cleaning. The problem was that there's no "Do Not Disturb" placard or sign that I can see for your door. The only hanging placard is for breakfast orders. Otherwise, it's pretty quiet minus the trolley bells. The surrounding area isn't too bad and it's a short downhill (followed by uphill on the return!) to many shops and Lombard st.
review.negativeRemarks: Ability to decline housekeeping service
review.locationRemarks: top of the hill means nice views but a tougher hike! Nice area though

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
We loved the hotel. The location was perfect. It was beautiful. The only 2 disappointments were the "Top of the Mark" & the shower. The top of the mark has a tiny 6 person bar with the rest consisting of all tables & a dance floor. Apparently it used to be a large bar & no matter where you sat you had a 360 degree view. I had to walk around interrupting other diners to see the views. Also, the shower had varying water pressure & temperature depending on the water use of other people's rooms.
Otherwise, the staff was incredible & drinks were delicious. Bed was comfy although all feather pillows & padding.

review.title: Awsome
review.reviewText: Love this hotel . Staffs are very helpful n provide info as n when needed

review.title: Nob Hill doesn't get much better
review.reviewText: Had a quick get a way into the city for Memorial day weekend. Stayed here at the Mark Hopkins. Iconic hotel. Center of action. Arrived before lunch and room ready....nice. Right off elevators but noise not an issue. Bigger issue was noise from California street trolley until after midnight as our room faced north onto California street. Only other dissapointment was the Top of the Mark was closed for private function. Room very nice, staff very helpful, location of hotel is good. Walked down hill to Chinatown for lunch. Taxi back to the hotel late in the day as it's a hike up the hills from anywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is 3-4 blocks down the hill. Union Square about 6 blocks down the hill. Try Mymy's for breakfast at 1500 California St.

review.title: Amazing stay great place
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous time and enjoyed ourselves mightily

review.title: Great old classic on Knob Hill!
review.reviewText: In San Francisco over Easter weekend and stayed at the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins. This is a great old hotel on Knob Hill. It sits in a great location, but very steep streets on either side of the hotel entrance and awkward driveway and valet parking situation. Very boring lobby with no bar or entertainment. Rooms are spacious, bathrooms are very nice and windows open for fresh air. Beds need to be updated because mattresses are lumpy and uncomfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, Bar at the top of the hotel, staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Beds #1. Breakfast incredibly expensive $75 for two people not including tax and tip!
review.locationRemarks: Great location for view of the city/proximity to cable cars. Not within walking distance to many areas of the city and the hill is very steep.

review.title: Best Hotel I've ever stayed in here in the USA.
review.reviewText:
As a frequent traveler, I've stayed at more hotels than I can count. The Mark Hopkins is the best hotel I've ever stayed in here in the US. Wonderful location, spectacular rooftop bar, and the best bacon I think I've ever had during breakfast!

In case you're wondering, the Adare Castle in, well, Adare, Ireland, is the best place I've ever stated.
review.negativeRemarks: I suppose the rooftop bar could be improved with some greater food items to nibble on.
review.locationRemarks: Magnificent location at the top of Nob Hill.

review.title: Beautiful hotel too far away
review.reviewText: This hotel is a beautiful landmark in San Francisco, but when I called and spoke to the staff regarding proximity to Moscone convention center, I was told that it was 0.2 miles from the center and a walkable distance.
