This was not true and there is another InterContinental hotel next to the Moscone center that nobody made mention of. The hotel is very grand and beautiful and if I were not traveling for business, it would be the perfect hotel for a pleasure trip. I was able to take a cab to the Moscone center and I would like to believe that Expedia made an error in stating that this hotel was one of the closer ones to the center. Also frustrating was the fact that my shuttle from the airport dropped me at the InterContinental close to the center and when I went to the front desk to check in, I was informed that I did not have a reservation. They had rooms available, but when I requested to transfer my reservation from the Mark Hopkins to this location, I was told that I must contact Expedia. I sat in the lobby and called attempting to get someone to help from Expedia for over an hour, and most of the time I was on hold waiting for a customer service rep. When someone did answer, they stated they needed to transfer me to someone else and disconnected my call. I found Expedia's customer service to be HORRIBLE!!! I gave up and took a cab to the hotel where I had a reservation.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a beautiful "grand dame" of a hotel with stunning rooms. The amenities are great and the mini bar in the room had everything you could want.
review.negativeRemarks: I A gift shop in the hotel. A more diverse menu in the restaurant near the lobby.

photos.caption: A beautiful Elmer Bischoff painting at the De Young.

review.title: Nob Hill Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a classic hotel with an excellent central location. It's a bit dated and could use an update, but is very comfortable with top notch friendly and professional staff. Sheets, pillows and bed are high quality and very comfortable. Be aware that wi-fi costs $15 extra and also the water in room is $6.50, so go to the nice little market down Powell St and pick up your own drinks and snacks. There is a great breakfast cafe below the market (Roxanne's) that serves a delicious and reasonably priced breakfast. Try the Nob Hill Cafe for a great neighborhood Italian meal (nearby on Taylor St.).

review.title: First Class Hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: We upgraded to the Club level and enjoyed some excellent amenities. Staff provided the highest quality of service.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were nothing to brag about. A little too soft for me.
review.locationRemarks: One block from California and Powell street Cable cars. Very convenient to public transportation and the city sites.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Mark Hopkins for two nights and really enjoyed our stay. We did upgrade our room when we arrived so that we could be on a higher floor. We also got free wifi by signing up for the Intercontinental Hotel rewards package.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. It was in a very nice location.
review.locationRemarks: The Mark Hopkins is in a very nice location. Three cable car lines are within a block. The cable car was a great way to get to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Grand Hotel
review.reviewText: Great historic hotel. Awesome experience. Must stay...

review.title: On the hill hard to walk to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
It is located top of the hill so when you do not drive to Union Square, it is very hard to walk.
And parking is very expensive compared to other, the bed is uncomfortable because the pillow is too soft and mattress is old so difficult to sleep.
I am not choosing the hotel anymore.
I

review.title: Left My Heart in SFO
review.reviewText: Staying at the Mark Hopkins on historic Nob Hill is to live and breathe the history of that fabled city, especially those postwar years when American jazz was at its peak. Don't expect glitz or piled-on amenities because the ambience is tasteful and low-key and truly San Francisco. The small touches like the small white orchids in the lobby are just right, not loud or gaudy.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff who are helpful with any question or request. Interior are amazingly well kept up for a structure with a long history.
review.negativeRemarks: The in-room Internet (wire) is a bit costly.
review.locationRemarks: The environs - hilltop park, Grace Cathedral and the cable car line running past - are perfect. Easy to walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Russian hill.

review.title: Such a nice respite.
review.reviewText:
We had a very difficult time with a rental car that was unsafe to drive on the hills in San Francisco. George, the concierge, was over the top helpful. He was able to get us another rental and we were able to get the unsafe car picked up! Thank you George!
We also were surprised to find live music and dancing at the Top!! It was the highlight of our stay! Rooms were very nice, clean, and quiet!

review.title: Nice hotel in a good neighborhood
review.reviewText: Good hotel, bartenders and waiters in both bars were very friendly. Didn't like that it was 20 min wait to get a drink at the top of the mark at 6p on a Friday, and it took 20 mins to get an elevator that wasn't full to the top from our 14th floor where we stayed. Apparently, one elevator broke down while carrying passengers and only one worked.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Service is good, location is convenient for us to Chinatown.

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed fo a weekend in February. We had a stanard room, small but very nice. Hotel staff was great. I have been to San Francisco many times. This is the nicest hotel I have stayed in. I would stay again.

review.title: Nice, noisy, nickel and dimed.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in decent location. Room is small but clean. Parking was $50, but expected. Our room was in the front of the hotel over the entrance and we could hear the valet, doormen, flag pole clanking, and guests as they entered the hotel at all hours. Could also hear other guests in the hallway and their rooms quite easily. Felt nickel and dimed by being charged for wifi. Most coffee shops offer free wifi. Overall the hotel was fine, but I would try another hotel next time, or request a room in a different location.

review.title: Great location in SF
review.reviewText:
Beautiful classic hotel in SF.

Got a great rate through Expedia and then upgraded upon checkin!

Overnight parking at the hotel was very expensive but convenient - might want to use the garage down the street

review.title: BEWARE FEMALE TRAVELERS - THIS HOTEL WILL NOT PROT
review.reviewText:
BEWARE FEMALE TRAVELERS - THIS HOTEL WILL NOT PROTECT YOUR SAFETY!
Let me start by saying that I've NEVER written a bad review in all my years of traveling the world - including my job producing and directing for The Travel Channel & Discovery. The Intercontinental Mark Hopkins hotel in San Francisco left me stranded at the waterfront wharf at 11pm at night when I told them I was alone and afraid and needed their help. They refused to call me a cab stating it was against their policy. I called the hotel to get me a cab as I didn't have a cab number on hand - my safari on my iPhone wasn't working and I didn't have Uber (which I've since downloaded) so I called my hotel (which I had programmed in my cell) and the hotel refused to call me a cab saying it was against their policy! I told them I was alone at the wharf . The hotel said they couldn't call me a cab but they could give me a number. I said I didn't have a pen to write it down and that it was dark and desolate needed their help and they said, "that's our policy, sorry, call back if you want a cab number" and then hung up on me! I called them back to get number and beg at this point for them to help me by calling a cab for me - a female guest alone and somewhat upset at this point - they rattled off number which I forgot and when I called back - they rattled it off and hung up again.
review.negativeRemarks: Policy regarding helping guests
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: The pokiest of rooms
review.reviewText: Tiny room was a huge disappointment. Barely room for one person to walk around the foot of the bed - my husband and I were constantly bumping into one another when getting ready. No bedside table on one side and the other side of the bed was flush against the desk as there was no space for decent furniture. Room service could not even wheel the table in due to lack of space, so we had just the plates and cutlery delivered. Surly greeting by staff on reception upon our late night arrival - quite a contrast to all the other hotels on our California holiday. Were the cold treatment and tiny room given just because we bought the room at a significant discount on expedia, I began to wonder? Despite the grand lobby and the great location, I would not recommend staying here - there are plenty of other hotels to choose from in the city.

review.title: Old fashioned elegance on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Could not have asked for a more professional and attentive staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful staff, comfortable bedding, nice views of the city
review.negativeRemarks: Gluten-free menu is needed.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in an upscale neighborhood, close to cable cars, Union Square, and even more elegant hotels nearby like the Fairmont next door.

review.title: Great View
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful whenever we needed assistanse either for something for our room or directions to a certain destination. The view of the city from the restaurant at top of the hotel on the nineteeth floor has to be seen to be believed. When we return to San Francisco We will be staying at the Mark Hopkins.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is on Nob Hill and only a ten dollar cab ride to fisherman warf. Chinatown is only three blockes from the hotel.

review.title: Old elegance
review.reviewText: Pleasant room, friendly staff, Nob Hill location is convenient
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Close to cable cars that can take you anywhere. On top of the Nob Hill with a beautiful view. Check out was a little nuts as they chose the morning to service 2 of the 3 elevators. Dining was available but not really affordable. For $20 they upgraded our room to a premium floor #15 of 18. Overall experience was nice and would probably go back.

review.title: Popular Tourist Hotel
review.reviewText: This was my 4th time staying at The Mark. I spent 5 days on a family vacation and enjoyed the visit as always.
review.positiveRemarks: The entire staff-doormen to housekeeping-were pleasant and helpful at every step.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms and public spaces are in grave need of some routine maintenance and refreshing. The halls shows major wear.
review.locationRemarks: This is a fabulous location to be near everything but away from the insanely noisy Union Square area.

review.title: A huge disappointment on New Year's Eve
review.reviewText: I called the hotel to verify that their best amenity, the Top of the Mark restaurant/bar/lounge would be open on New Year's Eve so we wouldn't have to go out searching for other options and could spend the entire evening at the hotel. The person I spoke with assured me that we'd have fabulous views of the city from the restaurant and said he'd try to get us a room with a view of the fireworks. I also verified that we could go to the Top of the Mark for breakfast on New Year's Day. He said yes and said there's a full buffet or we could order a la carte. So it all sounded great! Just what we were looking for! When we arrived, I asked if we could have a room with a view of the fireworks. The man said that there is no view of the fireworks from the hotel at all. After going to our room, we wanted to go up to the top floor to the restaurant for some food, drinks, and an excellent '360•view'. The elevator would not take us there! Apparently the restaurant was closed for a private party. What a huge disappointment. This was the entire reason why I booked this hotel. So we had to go elsewhere. After waking up on New Year's Day, I was excited to finally go to the Top of the Mark for a fabulous breakfast. But NO! It was only serving a special brunch and had been sold out for months. I cannot even tell you how disappointed I was...Especially since I had called in before booking, just to verify and confirm these things. Such a major disappointment :(

review.title: Good, quiet location.
review.reviewText: If you're ok with walking, this is an ideal spot to be. Less than a mile or two from so many wonderful neighborhoods - Chinatown, Union Square, even the waterfront.

review.title: lovely hotel despite.....
review.reviewText: grand old hotel located atop Nob Hill.....rooms were lovely despite the fact that the hotel was not originally able to honor bedding configuration booked through expedia...travelling with male and female adult children, I thought I booked a room for them with two double beds....on check-in, I was advised that despite confirmation from expedia as to that configuration, the hotel had no rooms with double beds left and therefore I was simply out of luck.....i requested that perhaps they would cancel the non-cancellable room so that we could find necessary accomodations elsewhere in town....they refused as reservation was already paid in full through expedia....i thereafter requested a cot as an option but again was disappointed by their response that they had no available cots either.....fortunately, they discovered a cancellation and were able to provide the originally requested room with two beds, but the experience was frustrating to say the least.....they did, however, send a bottle of wine up to the room but that didn't arrive until after 9 PM....altogether, not an impressive performance

review.title: Never have a bad experience.
review.reviewText: Go every year at Christmas. Always have a great, relaxing time. If only we wouldn't eat so much.
review.negativeRemarks: In our room bathroom could have been larger, but was functional as it is.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill in San Francisco. Walk downhill to Union Square to shop, breakfast at Sear's, lunch at Lefty's and cocktails at the hotel before dinner.

review.title: Comfort!
review.reviewText: Great bed, great pillows - very comfortable. Good view of the Fairmont & Pacific Union Club. Perfect for a holiday get away. We did a Christmas tree comparison of The Mark, Fairmont, Stanford Count, Big Four and the Mark was the best!
review.negativeRemarks: would love to have coffee in the room
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, Financial District, Embarcadero, Ferry Building, theatre, etc. Take the cable car to the Buena Vista

review.title: Lovely, elegant, not gaudy.
review.reviewText: Beautiful, classy stay at the Mark Hopkins. Breakfast was pricey. Note gratuity is included and clearly marked. Front desk and concierge staff were amazing, as was room service cashier--both went out of their way to accommodate all our needs. Must have fabulous insulation, as it was very cold outside, but the room was a constant comfortable. Was never able to get room cooler for sleeping though. I guess it was only set to heat so could only circulate room air below the current temp. No big deal. Lovely bathroom and bedding, comfortable bed. We got a great price on Expedia, plus inexpensive upgrade at front desk. Parking overnight is $60 so use cabs and streetcars or walk while in town. $6-$10 to the wharf/pier. BART is good for other places. For distance travel Avis (and Budget) is a 5 block downhill walk away, to rent a car for a day . . . . $31 on their own website vs. $70 on Expedia. The hotel had all the toiletries, but there's a little gift store in hotel across the street or Walgreens 2 blocks steeply downhill for pain relievers, etc. Our favorite breakfast was the Blue Mermaid down near the piers/wharf. Alcatraz was wonderful, but go early to miss crowds and buy ticket a few days in advance. New Oakland bridge portion so worth driving through. Alcatraz much better than I thought it would be, self-guided audio amazing, but buy tickets a few days in advance and go on the early boat and during week if possible, to avoid crowds.
review.locationRemarks: Muir Forest (redwoods), Sausalito, Carmel, 17 mile drive (Pebble Beach), new Oakland Bridge, Ghiradlli's chocolate.

review.title: Wonderful Stay at the Top of the Hill
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and it was in a great central location. It was a great place to stay for someone who has never been to the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff and convenience and safety of location.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown and Union Square. Very nice neighborhood.

review.reviewText: Hotel rooms need updating. Hotel staff does not feel like a 4 star hotel.
Incredible view from Top of The Mark
review.positiveRemarks: I love the character and history of this hotel

review.title: Very Disappointed!
review.reviewText: Waited 3 hours for a room to be cleaned!! Staff not very helpful on several occasions asked for information received negative answers. I always wanted to stay at the "Mark Hopkins" now that I've done it I NEVER BE BACK................
review.negativeRemarks: A staff that appreciates a Guest.I guess you must have to tip them twenty bucks to get results.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco there is hundreds of super things to do.

review.title: Great Hotel, just a long walk up a long steep hill
review.reviewText:
This Hotel is probably one of San Francisco's finest.
I paid just over $2k for 5 days, but well worth it. The rooms probably are due for a refresh, but the views from every window are great.
The Top of the Mark restaurant at the top is worth eating at. The menu is not the largest selection, but the food is very inexpensive and the views are to die for. 360 degree of all San Francisco.
I needed to do some work on Sunday and as there is no lobby area to eat/drink at, I wanted to sit in the restaurant at the top. Unfortunately, Sunday's is a fixed menu and very busy.
I was in casual attire and was greeted by the hostess, advising me that there is a fixed price of $70. I wasnt sure if that was because she thought I couldn't afford it, or the $70 is an issue with most people.
Regardless of some rudeness, the Hotel is very nice and staff mostly pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The roof top bar "Top Of The Mark", it's a must see.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need a refresh. They are not terrible, just tired.
review.locationRemarks: If you don't mind walking up steep hills, the location is fantastic. Best views around and Nob Hill is a great spot.

review.title: Beautiful building disappointing service
review.reviewText:
We found the service at this hotel grudging, and certainly not what you would expect for a hotel in this class. For example,the person who checked me in told me to ask the bellhop about commercial garages in the area (the hotel garage was much more expensive than others in the neighborhood). When I asked the bellhop for directions to the garage, he just said there were garages in both directions and walked away.

Aside from the service, the other disappointment was that there was more nickle and diming than I would have expected in a hotel of this type. Wifi, for example, is extra.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from the Top of the Mark is surely one of the best views in the city. Dancing on Saturday night.

review.negativeRemarks: Update the lobby with time period peices but that aren't tired.
review.locationRemarks: Grace Cathedral, Olea Restaurant

review.reviewText: Very nice and the location excellent for my convention,only a block away.

review.title: Beautful hstoryhotelof Sa Fran living hstory
Not Happy
review.reviewText:
Up graded to suite, place was not very clean at all. Front desk was good, they did print boading passes.
Not what i would call a 500 a night hotel. The bed was nice, bath linens very old not soft. Had to ask for more coffee twice.
review.positiveRemarks: location is good nice view of the city
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the rooms soft bath towels.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown Marina all close with street car right there.

review.title: Awesome location. Special place.
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel in a magnificent location. Know for its phenomenal views, the service and luxury in addition make this a top notch spot for a special get away. Check out Top of the Mark for sure!! Unfortunately the shower pressure left way too much to be desired for such an upscale accommodation. Rooms were clean enough but bathroom (tub area) could have been cleaner. All in all I'd probably stay there again!

review.title: Mark Hopkins Intercontinental
review.reviewText:
Staff is excellent ans super courteous. The A/C heating units in the rooms (we had 2 rooms) were constantly going off and on which were disturbing as they were loud.

Be prepared for paying for parking if you have rented a car. They charge 57 dollars a day and will not budge on the price.. I paid nearly 400.00 for parking.

The breakfast buffet included for 2 at The Top of the Mark each morning was absolutely fantastic. Loaded with great items to choose from and even a Dim Sum station! Breakfast was a super treat each morning and with the view of San Francisco all around you just cannot beat it. We could not wait to get to breakfast everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Price for parking and loudness of A/C units
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location on 1 Nob Hill. So close to many other attractions and great workout getting up and down the hill. Chinatown just 2 blocks away

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, elegant. Top of the Mark bar is really nice also.

review.title: Top of the Hill Beauty!
review.reviewText: Very clean, very pretty and well situated. Do not attempt to walk up the hill with your luggage! We stayed here for 4 nights and took advantage of the car service. Everything is within $8 to $10 cab rides. Walking distance (downhill) to China Town, North Beach & Union Square. The staff is accommodating to your every need. Top of the Mark is a must. I recommend this hotel to you!
review.negativeRemarks: Provide more creamers for in-room coffee!

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: City centre location, near Union Square and Chinatown, close enough to walk everywhere!
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were clean, air con worked, top of the mark was fantastic, staff were very helpful and friendly!
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking is steep and the inconvenience of paying for this hotel to have to pay extra for Wi-fi!
review.locationRemarks: Very centres to everything at the top of Nob Hill, the walks down either side of the hotel certainly will give you some exercise!

review.title: Great views, great staff, super friendly
review.reviewText: Long weekend to meet up with old friends, we enjoyed the Top of the Mark every night!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, bed and linens great, Top of the Mark wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower and sink low, tv remote batteries did not work, more food options
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the city close to everything...short taxi rides

review.title: Shabby Chic!
review.reviewText: My husband and I who are in our 30s were recommend it to stay here by a friend. It is certainly a very impressive looking building at the top of a steep hill with some great views from our corner room on the fourth floor. The staff are lovely and efficient, the room was comfortable and spacious, the downside is the noise from the street which could get quite loud even early in the morning as the windows are old style and not double glazed. As it is such a world-renowned hotel I was expecting the room decor to be a little less fusty but I am sure a lot of people would just find this olde world charming. The only real disappointment was the room service, a couple of the dishes that we ordered like chicken Caesar and the hamburger were not good at all In fact none of the room service ordered in our three days there was very good and it is very highly priced. Also a big shock was the valet parking which is over $50 per day And you have to pay for Wi-Fi $10 a day. However, all told it is a decent hotel with superb staff.
review.negativeRemarks: A little reupholstering wouldn't go amiss, valet parking should definitely be reduced, Wi-Fi should be free and the kitchen/room service needs a rethi
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and easy to get around all the main attractions of San Francisco

review.title: Great Hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The only thing that holds this hotel back from being a true 5 star experience is that the hotel is starting to get a bit dated, and will need a re-model in the future. Aside from that... truly 5 star service, wonderful amenities, great restaurant, and an wonderful location. I will stay here again.

review.title: Nice neigborhood
review.reviewText:
It wasn't bad at all. Is near from Union Square. When We arrive I found out that my room smells funny and the bed had a hole in the middle, the pillows wasn't good at all. When you stay in a hotel of that kind you expect your bed is comfortable, it was not
The case. Our view was bad. I ask for room change and they did soon, when we change room we didn't see that we have cigarretes in the trash, the othert day the maid report
It to the manager and they call me to tell me that is prohibited to smoke and I explain to him it was already there. The staff was corteus. Is located in a very nice neighborhood. The room don't have a drawer.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds and the room cleaning
review.locationRemarks: The location is good

review.title: Excellent Hotel.
review.reviewText: Awesome location on top of Nob Hill in a very nice quiet and peaceful neighbourhood. If you rely on transit and if walking uphill is not exactly your thing, then you're likely to rely on cable car. Only thing is, very often the cable car (ie Powell/Mason/Hyde) will be packed with visitors. The California cable car is satisfactory that stops right in front of the hotel. A better alternative would be a very good, reliable MUNI bus service (Route 1, "California") that has a stop a block away from the hotel. I personally found it very helpful to know the bus routes around the immediate area. Excellent local restaurants are a simple walk away from the hotel, notably City Chopsticks, Cable Car Cafe, Uncle Vito's Pizzeria. Otherwise, outstanding hotel with a lovely view of the neighbourhood.

review.title: Does not live up to expectations
review.reviewText: Service was acceptable, but people were not friendly. Room was well maintained, but non memorable.
review.negativeRemarks: Service.

review.title: WOW! Great Hotel in the old style of elegance
review.reviewText: Went to see a show at the Marine Memorial Theatre which was a simple walk. Excellent dinner at the Big Four Restaurant (another SF icon) in their lounge just up the street from the Mark Hopkins. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite by the staff. Knock out view of the city for breakfast and fabulous breakfast buffet at the Top of the Mark Restaurant on the 19th floor with stunning vistas of the skyline. Breakfast was worth the drive to the city. Definitely worth a return visit to this classic hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: IPOD docking stations
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill. Big Four Restaurant. Marine Memorial Theatre.

review.title: Great location for sight seeing on Nob Hill
review.reviewText:
Impressive facade when first arriving at the hotel. The staff is fast, courteous and very helpful with directions and recommendations.
Taxis are hailed immediately when needed. The staff here is the best I have encountered at any hotel. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a nice view of Nob Hill. Cable cars drive right by during the day and evening -- it was really charming to hear their bells as they go through the intersection. Rooms are climate controlled but both of our windows opened and that breeze was very nice. No fridge (except mini-bar) and no microwaves anywhere on the premises. Our room was fairly large, especially by San Francisco standards, but no extra frills. The location is probably where the price came in, but there were little extras that made it a special experience: electronic 'do not disturb' settings, free New York Times by the elevators, daily maid service and prompt taxi service.
For those visiting in July, be aware that the cable cars were always packed and never stopped.
I would absolutely recommend others to stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. We loved being able to walk to most sights. Be aware walking down Nob Hill is great, but you have to walk back UP. lol
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for walking to many sights in the city: Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy, and China Town are within walking distance.

review.title: Nice, clean hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed San Francisco it is a beautiful place and this hotel was very clean and neat. It is close to Union Square where you can get on the hop on and off touring bus that takes you to all of the best locations in San Francisco. The staff at this hotel were excellent, they took care of our vehicle and made sure we had a wonderful stay there. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a clean and had friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Location is great near Union Square.

review.title: Great location-wonderful view from Top of the Mark
review.reviewText: The hotel seems a little bit dated, but that's part of its historic charm. With a bar menu that includes 100 martinis, how can you go wrong?

review.title: Classy old fashined hotel at the top of the city.
review.reviewText: I took my wife and married daughter there. They had never been to San Francisco. They absolutely loved it. It is a beautiful, well maintained old fashioned hotel. The rooms are tastefully decorated. The staff are very attentive. Topping off a full, tiring day of sightseeing, I took them to the Top of the Mark for a night cap. They loved the views.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. The cocktail lounge at the top of the hotel, The Top of the Mark, has a 360 degree unobstructed view of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing that I noticed
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill. California St. cable car runs outside. Quiet, classy neighborhood.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff- they excel in customer service! One of our 2 rooms was a little noisy because it was a connecting room. Overall, wonderful
experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Location to cable cars and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Older hotel so you can't do anything about the walls.

review.title: Very comfy, pleasant and top of San Fran
review.reviewText: Clean, well kept and professional hotel. Concierge George was not very pleasant when I asked him about regional travels. I don't know if I asked a wrong guy or he was just too busy to be polite. The front desk girl told me to ask him so I did and he was busy answering calls trying to answer my questions. I could've waited but he asked what my question was so I told him. He came around nice when I checked my bag for short walking trip though. Otherwise excellent experience.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to visit China town, downtown restaurant, and Lombart St. Right in front of tram stop.

review.title: Beautiful View of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel, lovely view from cocktail bar on the top floor. Only regret was walking up Nob Hill with suitcase and heavy laptop bag.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooftop cocktail bar, large comfortable rooms, location, fitness room
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to access on foot with luggage

review.title: Nice hotel close to China Town & other ammenities
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but our room is on 3rd floor and it facing the street so the noise of the cable car were unbearable.
review.negativeRemarks: May be changing to new window to block the noise from the street.
review.locationRemarks: Like to walk to China Town for food

review.title: Nice, but dated Hotel Needs refurbishing
review.reviewText:
odd mix of great people, sloppy service, and sub-standard facilities.
Bad Items:
Concierge is ALWAYS unavailable NEVER calls back
Doorman has to be sent for to hail a cab, since he is invisible
They do NOT have on-demand movies even with a pay option.
NO exhaust fan in the bathroom
Small, scary elevators
Housekeeping was poor, room service made mistakes.
BUT:
once you get their attention the people are VERY nice.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING, from room facilities to services.
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown. Cable ride takes you down to Fisherman's Wharf. Roxanne's a great breakfast place few blocks down.

review.title: This hotel is close to all the city has to offer.
review.reviewText: We were greeted by Sal, the doorman. he was super nice and very helpful. We checked in with John at the desk. John was very welcoming and made the check in a pleasant experience. I did not have as good of an experience with the rest of the staff I dealt with during our stay. We wanted to dione at The Top Of The Mark for our anniversary. The evening before we decided to take the elevator up to see the atmosphere of the dining room and the options we had to choose from on the menu. The Host greeted us and we were told that unless we were seated we could not view the menu nor could we see the lay out of the dining room. We were treated with an abrupt tone and we felt uncomfortable. We never ended up dining there for our special evening. The room we stayed in was beautiful and well maintained. We were close to all public transportation and within walking distance of shopping, eateries and sites to see. I approached the concierge desk to ask about transportation options to get to the San Francisco Zoo. We were given wrong directions and told to ride the wrong Muni train to get to our intended destination. We got corrected information from the attendent at the Muni station and ended up on the right train. When I was given the option of taking a cab, I asked the approx cost of that option. When I asked the concierge how much the cab cost, her whole demeanor changed with me and she treated me as if I had no right to ask the cost. Everyone has the right to inquire price.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location. You felt close enough to all the hustle and bustle yet far enough away from the pedestrian traffic and noise of the inner city.
review.negativeRemarks: The treatment could be improved. I feel that people should not be judged by the questions they ask or by wanting to explore their options.
review.locationRemarks: You are within walking distance of Fishman's Wharf, China Town, many dining choices/coffee shoppes, public transportation and large shopping areas.

review.title: Nice area! Nice view!
review.reviewText: I had a really good time over there. The hotel was very close to the union square and it has the cable car stations right in front. Very beautiful view of down town! Overall I liked the hotel. It was a little bit expansive but it worthed! The hotel itself was clean and had a good service!

review.title: what a great location
review.reviewText: It is located on the top of Nob Hill. Beautiful views. Charming experience. It appears the rooms, especially the bathrooms, were recently updated. The marble was beautiful. The sheets were 500 count (we asked) and the pillows came in a range of firmness
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. The experience of staying in an older hotel that has been lovingly maintained and updated was just what we were looking for.
review.negativeRemarks: There is not a true restaurant. The Top of the Mark serves a bar menue, ie: sliders, etc. We ate breakfast at the adjacent Fairmont hotel
review.locationRemarks: it was away from the Convention Center and Fisherman's wharf so there were no panhandlers. I felt very safe. Cable cars are very convenient

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Only 3 elevators. Made it slow in response on the first night and next day of my stay. Rumor was that the Vice President was staying there.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice all round view in the Top of the Mark.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow, small, elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to some shopping and tourist locations. Unfortunately at the top of the steep hills. Along line of cable car.

review.title: Great Hotel on the Hill
review.reviewText: The professional and personal reception I received upon checking was outstanding, nothing less than I had expected and had received in years passed. One of the main reason why I continue to stay at The Mark Hopkins International. My room was clean and relaxing, definitely a 5 stars hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, location, property and Top of the Mark restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Better WiFi service.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close to The Mark Hopkins, since it is centrally located in the city. Tons of restaurants, close to the Wharf and Union Square.

review.title: Top of the Mark!
review.reviewText: Top class service, comfortable rooms, and the best view in town. Highly recommended!

review.title: Fancy and chic.
review.reviewText: When I arrived at the hotel, I missed to drive into the hotel. I didn't think it would be my hotel. It has very fancy looking. Bell man is noble and kind, so as the other clerks. However the facilities are minimum. The beauty is It is located at the top of San Francisco, so you can have the best view of downtown SF around you. You must have nightcap at The Top of The Mark bar, open by 11:30, where you can have the best overlooking night view!

review.title: nice loby average room
review.reviewText: if you don't mind walking up hill, this is a good place to stay

review.title: Old and a Little Tired
review.reviewText:
The hotel was recomended by a business associate as a special place to stay with a great view fom the resturant on the top floor.
I found the hotel staff a little stuffy, the rooms up to date but very small, the view great, but more than offst by the service at the resturant.
Can not imagine repeating the experience.

review.title: Elegance, tremendous service, noise, bad breakfast
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel, gorgeous rooms, excellent and supremely courteous staff. Had a lower floor room facing the entrance and the street noise over night was awful. Got moved to 6th floor for a quiet room with a spectacular view. Breakfast at the Top of the Mark cost $70. Food was cold, the coffee creamer was filthy. Other than that, the Top of the Mark offers breathtaking views. Overall, however, this is a truly majestic and beautifully restored hotel.

review.title: Best hotel to stay in downtown
review.reviewText:
this was our first stay at a downtown hotels after 3 trips to sf,
It was the best experience and ideal place to move around and visit the best part of sf.
20 mins drive to the airport,close to the golden gate,fisherman's etc
I stayed with my beautiful wife and we loved every day,
We stayed here for 4 nights.the hotel was clean well maintained beyond our expectation
Room service was good except for one night the bread was over night,otherwise a pleasing stay

review.title: suitable for elderly people
review.reviewText:
I would point out that the hotel does not have a full blown dining room and I dont like my dinner served in my room. on the plus side the breakfast was superb and in the evening there was
often some form of music including Jazz or evena big band along with light dining snack type things. 200 yds from the hotel is a top rate restuarant called 'The big four'
review.negativeRemarks: size of bathroom
review.locationRemarks: fabulous position on the top of Nob Hill

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We got there at 10am and they had a room available for early check-in. Staffs are very friendly, room is clean and comfortable, but the bathroom is really small. Location is great!!! The hotel is on top of the hill, so everywhere we go is walking downhill. We got the 3 days pass for the cable cars, which is right in front of the hotel, very convenient!!! Good thing we did not rent a car, would not park for $52/night. Would definitely go back if we can find a good deal again!
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient, great location! On top of the hill, cable cars right in front of the hotel.

review.title: $ 52 plus 14% tax for overnight parking
review.reviewText: If you are not familiar with this area beware. I gave this hotel a 2 because of the parking situation. Although this hotel is relatively close to many popular destinations I dare you to try getting to them. I double dare you to find parking or better yet fairly priced parking. You are better off walking. The VALET ONLY service brought little relief to the pain it was to get in and out of the hotel.

review.title: Amazing buffet
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the stay,The best is the breakfast amazing views!

review.title: good value, great family experiance
review.reviewText: Unlike most modern hotels they beds are basically full-size not Queens. Therefore for those accustomed to a Queen it is a slightly smaller experience. The decor is a bit dates but is tidy, nothing chic but pleasing.
review.positiveRemarks: View from the Top of the Mark
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: Great - easy to get many places and super for experiencing the cable cars

review.title: Top marks!
review.reviewText: We love the feel and location of the Mark Hopkins. Perfectly situated to dive into our favorite neighborhoods in the City with ease. The room this year did not have a Bay view as compared to our last visit but still provided a lovely shot of the Nob Hill skyline was an adequate substitute. Top of the Mark cocktails two nights did not disappoint in the least as to the quality of the beverages or the view. Staff is always courteous and professional. Room comfort was more than adequate and maid service was prompt and thorough. Special arrangements for a birthday bouquet of roses was handled promptly and with minimal effort by the concierge and my wife was delighted with the quality of the arrangement. All in all a great stay.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for exploring the City on foot or using public transit

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and location, superb breakfast, good views from Top of the Mark, nice to have complimentary newspapers.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient Nob Hill

review.title: Nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: When I was in SF area and looked at the address of this hotel. I thought Expedia booked me the wrong one. I called Expedia and was not very friendly at least. It turned out it was the one that I intended to stay. I should call Expedia and apology for my manners.

review.title: Lots of positives !!!
review.reviewText: The room was clean the bed was comfy the ammenities pleasing..the top of the mark had fabulous band and dancing was WONDERFUL with incredible views and no cover for guests. My only negative comment would be the vanity area in bathroom is small so tough for traveling items with more than one person..meaning one man or one woman its fine but for more than one - pretty cumbersome. Location is wonderful - close to cable car lines short walk to Union Square, North Beach lots of choices. GREAT work out too!

review.title: A nice peice of history
review.reviewText: The staff, location and hotel atomosphere are superb. Beds are very comfortable, with high quality linens. It is an older property though and noise from room to room and from the street was noticeable. I knew every time a taxi was hailed by the doorman, and heard the "play by play" of both my neighbor's late night romance. Bring ear plugs if you need absolute quiet to get good rest. Rooms are well appointed, but small by modern standards. The bathrooms are tiny! There is no way two people can get ready at the same time. If this had recently opened it would be considered a "boutique" property. It is a nice peice of history though and worth a visit.
review.negativeRemarks: noise
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is great but not for night life.

review.title: Great get away weekend! Very cozy and elegant!
review.reviewText: It was elegant and yet cozy and friendly - not stuffy or intimidating.
review.negativeRemarks: The service that replaced coffee,skipped us and of course we didn't notice until morning and housekeeping did not carry. Minor Disappointment
review.locationRemarks: Excellent - right at the trolley, within walking of excellent dining, and Union Square.

review.title: Top of the World in SF
review.reviewText: Classic old hotel, great views from Knob Hill. Would only recommned with the discount rates. Hotels 1 to 2 blocks down the hill around the Union Square area can be substantially less expensive with more ammenities (eg, free wi-fi) and more space. Nickle and dime the guest for parking, wi-fi, etc. Staff was nice, professional and helpful. Welcome to high-end SF hotel stays.
review.negativeRemarks: Price and extra charges

review.title: Great location, comfort and upkeep.
review.reviewText: The location is perfect for exploring around downtown San Francisco. It's walking distance to chinatown, union square, the marina and fishermans wharf, as well as polk street nightlife. Hotel is beautiful and the room was spacious and very comfortable. Definitely recommend.

review.title: Biz Traveler
review.reviewText:
Charming hotel but walls were thin...got woken up at 5:30am by the neighboring room.
Gym was pretty dismal.
Complimentary car service was not available when I asked about it...disappointing as I was there for business and needed a quick ride to my office
review.negativeRemarks: Gym, thin walls
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: #1 Hotel Choice While Staying In San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Best service of any hotel I have ever stayed at....period.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: great for couples -spending time sightseeing.
review.reviewText: I felt safe and comfortable. there was a strange odor that did not go away evev after extra cleaning by house keeping staff. limited space for storage/clothing drawers almost none existance space no exaust fan in the bathroom .location was very good.staff was friendly.and helpful.also the buffet was good.when I booked in with expedia I wasnt told that to get a good/excellant view that I need to book a room at higher rate. I was not told that when booking. It should have been my choice.
review.negativeRemarks: small room, noisey in early am
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Perfect location and best view of San Fran
review.reviewText: Perfect location, room was nice, the room and bathroom are a little small but overall great hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect and central

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: While we appreciate that it's an older hotel, we would still expect an iconic Intercontinental property to meet a higher standard. There was nothing really wrong, but the place seemed like it was starting to fray at the edges a bit - the bed was a bit saggy, the elevator cars were banged up, linens were 3-star quality, etc. Sorry to say, the place just didn't wow us. Our room backed up to the elevator shaft. So we had to listen to that creaky old elevator car whiz past our heads all night long. If you can avoid it, don't bring your car; parking is $52 a night. Lastly, it's ridiculous that a hotel of this caliber charges for wifi internet access.

review.title: Grand Dame Still a Warm Welcome
review.reviewText: The Mark is a grand dame of San Francisco and a special part of the history of Nob Hill in particular. Not slick or showy or interested in being either. The location is glorious, great views in all directions (this is the San Francisco of a generation ago, when you got great views by being atop one of the hills and not by taking an elevator up in a high-rise). The staff are highly professional but not stuffy or off-putting. It's all old-fashioned in the best sense of the word, yet the mix of people staying here is remarkably diverse.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough options for food and drink.
review.locationRemarks: Legendary.

review.title: Great hotel, close to attractions and public trans
review.reviewText: Staff was nice, room was clean and great location.

review.title: A Grand Dame with a boutique feel.
review.reviewText:
The Mark Hopkins is our favorite place to stay in San Francisco, truly the jewel of Nob Hill. What sets it apart for us is the grandness of the place yet it feels like a small boutique hotel with excellent, personal service. If you want the massive, impressive lobby, restaurants, bars and other amenities (like movies on demand for instance) you'll need to stay across the street at the Fairmont....but you'll also have the large crowds to deal with and less personal service. When staying at the Mark, I highly suggest upgrading to the Club Lounge which can be done at check-in for $30 per person per night. In fact, I probably wouldn't stay at the Mark if I didn't upgrade because it makes up for the lack of amenities. The Club Lounge is a great peaceful, elegant retreat just off the lobby. Some of the Club Lounge amenities include a breakfast buffet, afternoon tea and sweets, evening Hors d'oeuvres with complimentary cocktails, beer, wine, bottled water, soft drinks, and juices all day long.

Our only issue during our five-night stay was one morning there was no hot water so the showers were quick and refreshing. The Front Desk manager sent up a bottle of wine with his apologies. Truthfully, this happened to us on one of our previous stays and the room rate was cut in half for one night (we didn't ask for more compensation but maybe shoud have).

We had Christmas Dinner at the famous Top of the Mark Restaurant and Lounge; it was too pricey for mediocre buffet food.

review.title: No hot water available.
review.reviewText:
There was no hot water available for shower. I called the room service, but they said there was a system problem on 26th of December. So they did not suggest any alternative so that I took a cold shower at Intercontinental Hotel...And no compensation, no words of sorry.

Other than that, I liked the hotel, Christmas decoration, comfort and cleanliness of the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel in Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Great staff and nice rooms. This is all I wanted to share.

review.title: Great location, great price!
review.reviewText: The driveway entrance is complicated since it's as if you have to drive onto the sidewalk to get in, but the entrance itself is very nice. The concierge was super helpful, she found us reservations on christmas eve. The hotel itself is a bit dated, water pressure is low, the windows are old and quite a bit of noise and cold creeps in (very noticeabble in the middle of December), but the heater ran well and the bed was very comfortable. Overall, great location and we got a great deal so very happy!
review.negativeRemarks: old windows meant it was cold inside and we could hear the trolleys constantly
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is super convenient prime location and beautiful!

review.title: Outstanding.
review.reviewText: Outstanding experience all around. Staff, room, services etc. Highly recommended and a true SF institution.

review.title: "Watch out for the parking fee"
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel, but the parking fee is outrageous. It did not make the hotel discount worth the stay, considering utilizing public transportation (cable car, taxi) or even using our own car to park somewhere else any cheaper. The parking fee would have been more tolerable if the two of us (who had driven individually) could have paid one $59.00 fee.
The food and entertainment at the Top of the Mark were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful but not worth the parking fee

photos.caption: Nob Hill from 10th Floor of the Mark

review.title: Breakfast at the Top of the Mark
review.reviewText:
We were provided with the front and center room on the tenth floor facing the Flood Mansion and Grace Cathedral. Windows can open! How rare is that? We could listen to the cable cars passing periodically (or close the double glazed window for quiet).
Most hotels with a top floor lounge make it available only in the evening. The "Top of the Mark" is available as early as 6:30 for breakfast with a spectacular view!
review.negativeRemarks: Confusing Breakfast Buffet layout
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill

review.title: The very best seat in the very best city....
review.reviewText: Arrive at the magnificent Intercontinental Mark Hopkins (IMH) and you have arrived at the "very top of San Francisco" with breathtaking views of the city and beyond in every direction. Check into your beautifully updated room in this gorgeous vintage hotel and then take the elevator all the way to the "Top of the Mark Bar". Go all the way to the Bar in the corner of this dining room and sit in the widow seats. You are now sitting in the best chair, with the best view in San Francisco. Cocktail anyone? Oh and the breakfast is well worth the few extra dollars if you book in advance. I was allowed to "pile two plates high" at 11:00 AM (the official close of the breakfast serving) and take them back to our room to thoroughly enjoy before check out at noon. San Francisco is one of my favorite places on the planet and the IMH is one of the very best hotels in that city....perhaps THE best
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The best of the best
review.userLocation: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA

review.title: Wonderful getaway in the heart of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Quiet and comfortable room. Soft feather bed and luscious sheets. Dreamy toiletries and good coffee. Fabulous location.
review.negativeRemarks: no free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Just wonderful view and great place to have as a home base for a great city.

review.title: San Francisco Classic
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel is a classic that I recommend. However, for the price I expected the room (especially the bed) to be slightly more comfortable and wifi to be included (which it was not).
review.negativeRemarks: Uncomfortable Bed, No wifi included
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance (as long as you don't mind hills) to many tourist attractions

review.title: Overall OK but don't expect too much.
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was OK. don't expect too much though. Our room was very nice, in the corner so we had 2 nice windows. however the blackout was broken and we couldn't close the drapes at night. The water pressure wasn't that good either. The service was OK and people were nice. Again, it was fine if you need a comfortable hotel, but don´t expect a 5 star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: bad maintenance in room
review.locationRemarks: Nice views, but hard to get there. Walking up there takes a looooong time.

review.title: Great hotel for a celebration
review.reviewText: We were celebrating our anniversary and received a complimentary bottle of champagne which was truly appreciated.

review.title: Great hotel, great location, great view!
review.reviewText: Have stayed here twice, and both times everything was great and done right. Also a great central location.
review.positiveRemarks: Service and location can't be beat.
review.locationRemarks: walk down hill from all sides into Union Square, or North Beach, or Fisherman's wharf area, or Cow Hollow.

review.title: Pet friendly or humans w/pets - I THINK NOT
review.positiveRemarks: the bathroom, room service, valet front or garage
review.negativeRemarks: the front desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Not great if driving since the entrance to the hotel looks like driving onto a handicap space entrance and Nob Hill 1 is not the accurate address

review.title: great hotel for everyone!
review.reviewText: Wonderful old world style and grace and great location to many attractions that San Francisco has to offer. Cable car runs directly in front of hotel. Don't miss the Top of the Mark for drinks at night and morning breakfast, amazing views of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, charm, breakfast, comfort, cable cars very near
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown, North Beach Italian area, Ferry building, financial district and Union Square
review.userLocation: Long Island City, Queens, NY, USA

review.title: Landmark hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for two nights while on vacation. Staff was courteous and helpful. Room was comfortable and clean. Although this is an old hotel, it is in terrific condition. Terrific view and excellent drinks at Top of the Mark. On the down side, rooms are expensive (but it is Nob Hill), morning coffee service is cut off early (8:00 a.m.), and parking is very expensive. However, I would stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Very Nice staff and hotel
review.reviewText: We were in San Francsico for a wedding. I would recommend this hotel to our friends

review.title: Top of the Mark
review.reviewText: Room never cleaned in 4 days. Had to ask for extra towels. Nice location, "Top of the Mark", etc. $34.00 breakfast buffet. GREAT views. Helpful concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill

review.title: top of the mark ..amazing time
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel superb location and views............
........

review.title: Unaccommodating staff
review.reviewText:
While the staff were polite, they were very unresponsive to our requests. Also, they could not fulfill ANY of our requests during booking (2 double beds vs. 1 king) and the staff was very adamant that they do NOT have any such rooms, while another guest checking in next to us got one.
The lobby is kept beautifully despite rather ordinary upkeep of the basic rooms.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Love the location. Staff was very helpful. I've stayed here before and had a great time meeting the group in the bar on the top. This stay was more romance oriented. We ended up on the second floor with frosted window to cover up the view of the bird netting on the roof below. Definitely request a higher room with a towards one of the two streets that make up this hotel's corner location.

Our bed was uncomfortable which did not match the experience from our previous stay. It wasn't blatantly bad but just enough that you realized the next morning you were up quite a bit of the night. Also, we needed to use the office center but all of the computers were out of order or would not allow log in. Made for an interesting challenge when trying to print show tickets.

All in all I would say it's a nice hotel and has a fairly reasonable price for what you get. The location is by far the biggest perk.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill (does mean you may want to consider a taxi when returning from excursions)

review.title: Great location and well maintained hotel
review.reviewText:
For an older hotel the Mark Hopkins was well maintained and updated. The room was very very clean and a thorough inspection revealed no bugs or signs of bugs.

The elevators were often quite crowded as they are quite small but that's really the only complaint.

Great location that's on 2 cable car lines and a transit pass is highly recommended
review.negativeRemarks: lots of walking up and down steep hills made a transit pass a necessity.
review.locationRemarks: very central, 4 blocks downhill to union square. 10 min cable car ride to financial district. At the top of steep hill, walking difficult.

review.title: A wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: A beautiful historic hotel that has maintained its dignity and cleanliness. It is located in a beautiful part of town, right atop Nob Hill, directly next to a cable car and right across the way from the gorgeous Grace Cathedral. If you plan to walk, be prepared for steep hills which surround at least two of the intersecting streets!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive Parking.

review.title: Nice hotel perfectly located
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel perfectly located in Nob Hill. It's up the hill and from there you can either walk down to Union Square & Market Street, or walk to Fishermann's Wharf (a good 15 minutes walk). Chinatown is just a few blocks away and the cable car passes just in front of the hotel. The area is very nice and safe.
The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. For instance, they helped us booking a rental car or tickets for a baseball game. Breakfast is excellent, good quality but quite expensive. It takes place in the restaurant on the top 18th floor with a fantastic view over SF: great!
The room was fine but could have been a bit bigger, especially because we were 4 in the room (2 adults and 2 children). In addition, there was too little place in the cardboards for our clothes. It is probably perfect for business purposes or a couple, but not designed for a family travelling around for 3 weeks (we stayed 5 nights in the hotel, so we did unpack our suitcases). The bathroom was also quite small.
I was also surprised on the first evening when I wanted to have dinner with the kids at 9:15 pm. We could not go to the restaurant because minors are not accepted after 9:30pm because of alcohol licence. All in all, we had a good time in the hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendliness of staff, great view from breakfast room
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive breakfast, little space for clothes
review.locationRemarks: Nice area, centrally located in Nob Hill, across from Fairmont Hotel, close to cable car station.

review.title: Beautiful, elegant old hotel with great service!
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel that was very elegant! The staff was very professional and treated us like we were royalty. The bellmen were always quick to get us either a cab or our car and gave great directions if we needed them. The only slightly negative was the restaurant upstairs was very expensive for the breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: We were lucky to have a beautiful corner room that we could open the windows in and got a nice little cross breeze! The bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive breakfast upstairs in the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Up on a hill, kind of hard to figure out how to get into the entrance for the first time, but easy once you get it. Lots of traffic in the area.

review.title: Avoid for business travellers
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a good location, the rooms are good, has a great geographical location if you are into views etc ...

However the staff is pretty bad at getting back to customers, especially business ones.

While I am a platinum ambassador with Intercontinental (highest membership level), I asked for an extension but instead of getting a yes or a no, I got: we will get back to you and only after two inquiries with the front desk they said they could not.

I do not think this is a good policy for frequent travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: Reception
review.locationRemarks: excellent location for leisure travellers

review.title: Great place for all trips!
review.reviewText: I went on a trip with some girlfriends and we had the best experience at this hotel! Great service, clean and comfy rooms, awesome concierge service... The Top of the Mark is a great place to grab a drink at night with amazing views of the city. I can not rave ENOUGH about how helpful the concierge was over the few days we were there, they helped us out quite a bit! Would recommend to anyone looking to stay in the city!
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge service, Top of the Mark
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Nice location, not too far from touristy spots

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and friendly. After we figured out our MUNI transportation options, the hilltop location was great. My only complaint is that we could hear the people in the room next door - conversations, baby crying, TV, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls
review.locationRemarks: Great views

review.title: Sunday mornig experience
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco.
Onlyv the fact that they do not serve breakfast on Sundays at Top of the Mark was negative, everything else... Just enjoyed he stay!
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly servers and door men!
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast at Top of the Mark on Sundays!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, inexpensive parking just a block away!

review.title: Great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: First time my fiance and I brought his daughter with us. We love going as a couple, but would definitely come again as a family!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable and we enjoyed our stay. The only issue we had was with other guests, which the hotel isn't necessarily responsible. A group in adjacent rooms came in around 2:30am and decided to have a party in the hallway. A call to the front desk had the issue resolved in about 45 minutes. Otherwise, we loved the location - we did a nice walk down to Fillmore St and on to Union St. It was a quick walk to Union Square, but we were away from the crowds and up enough of a hill that it was quiet around the hotel. Great views.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Too noisy. Everything that happens in nearby room is heard clearly. Door closing in any near room beats like thunder

review.title: Timeless Beauty
review.reviewText: Arrived at 1 a.m. - Was met by a doorman, helped to the room, was made aware of the services still available at this hour, and given a brief overview of the hotel. The concierge provided answers to ALL of our questions and was most helpful. Was even offered an inexpensive mode of transportation back to the airport (shuttle) which saved us 30-40 dollars. The hotel is a classic older, but extremely well maintained building - you will feel like you've been transported back to the elegance of earlier years. Absolutely beautiful! Would stay again. Only downside . . . . not much available in the immediate area that is easily walked to. Shopping is a close 4-5 blocks away, but requires use of the trolley to navigate return via the extremely sloped walkways!!!

review.title: couples retreat
review.reviewText: had a nice scenary, but the party upstairs ends at 12:30. everyone was nice and the beds and bathroom were nice. toilet set a bit cheap.
review.negativeRemarks: TOILET SEAT and parking
review.locationRemarks: parking is crazy but prepare for the $52 parking valet

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Great location & nice atmosphere - will stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed & good size room - King Delux room
review.negativeRemarks: Old elevator - but they are charming
review.locationRemarks: Great location - short walk to union square & Starbucks!

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Outdated chic - Hotel was lovely and we enjoyed staying there.

review.title: Grand old modern hotel
review.reviewText: A grand old hotel - that has stayed modern and personal
review.negativeRemarks: Tough walk home up the hill!

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: We were there for the 75th ann. of the bridge. We could see the fire works from our room. Everything was so special. Would stay here again

review.title: Elegant, Well Situated
review.reviewText: This is an outstanding hotel with great service and very beautiful rooms. The location is also central to Fisherman's Wharf , Union Square, and Chinatown. The cable car is one block away and they offered complimentary town car service from 5-8p to local areas (e.g Union Square). President Obama even had a fundraiser at the hotel on 2/17/12! The Top of the Mark is good as an after dinner stop.

review.title: Top Marks for the Mark Hopkins!
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay - may be a bit pricey but it is a top class Hotel with a stunning view fro the 'Top of the Mark' breakfast and restaurant area. Worth paying for a room on the highr floors to get a fantastic view over the city and the bay beyond. food superb especially the champagne brunch on Sunday

review.title: Beautiful.
review.reviewText: Perfect experience. Beautiful room, incredible service, and an amazing view.

review.title: Good Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful historic hotel at the top of Nob Hill. The room was really clean and had an amazing view (and we were only on the second floor!). The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The staff were very friendly. We ordered room service for breakfast one day and it was very good. The view from Top of the Mark bar is wonderful, the drinks not so much. The drawbacks to this hotel are that it is on top of a hill, great for views, not so good for those getting around on foot who are not used to hills. Because it is an older hotel, the rooms and bathrooms tend to be smaller than we are used to.
review.positiveRemarks: The super comfy bed and the views
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Sits on top of a very big hill. You can get coffee across the street in the Fairmont's cafe. This will save you from the climb first thing.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Ok but could have gotten same sort of room for lesser price elsewhere. Guess they keep there 5 star rating only for their deluxe or executive rooms. If you are going for standard why pay this much what you can get at holiday inn
review.negativeRemarks: Price for the quality of service and room
review.locationRemarks: Central to most things to see in San francisco

review.title: Mark Hopkins San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Helpful staff. Located at the top of a very steep hill. Not for the disabled!
review.negativeRemarks: All extras expensive
review.locationRemarks: Perfect to access the city, but at thje top of a steep climb up. Cable cars and taxis easily available

review.title: Stay somewhere else.
review.reviewText: Upon arrival the hotel desk staff said they would accomodate my request for a room away from the elevator and ice machine, etc. They did not. We were given a room nearby to the elevator and ice machine. We were so tired from traveling and focused on our schedule that we did not protest. The beds had a cheap, flimsy mattress pad to soften the hardness. The bathroom toilet flushed LOUDLY. It needs repair. One bathroom vanity sink faucet dripped. The room cooling/heating system is very slow. The hotel apparently has a new policy of attracting cruise ship guests to it's list of customers. They packed the hotel. High school prom parties at the Mark? One of those happened as well. Finally, our two son's and their families stayed the same night and each were disappointed. One got room service food but it wasn't what they ordered and was poor qualiy. Thier meal wasn't deducted from the bill! The desk staff gave them an excuse. My other son ordered room service and it never arrived! We will NEVER recommend the Mark or ever stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Read my review. Don't stay here.
review.locationRemarks: Central.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel was excellant. The only thing was room service pick up was slow. We had breakfast, called for pick up. By the time we were ready to leave the room for the day the breakfast was still in the room. I called them again and told them I was placing the cart outside the room for them to pick up. When we returned to the room after a long day of seeing the site, the cart was still in the hallway.
Again, overall the stay was wonderful and very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: How clean and comfortable the room was
review.negativeRemarks: Room service pick up
review.locationRemarks: Close to the trolley but a good walk downhill to the Wharf etc

review.title: Spectacular Views
review.reviewText: Nice and friendly staff. Spectacular view of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The fantastic views of the city from the Top of the Mark
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText:
I was impressed that even though this used to be one of THE hotels to stay in, it was maintained well and though tired has aged gracefully. Was disappointed by the Top that used to be elegant and now is very far from that. My wife had a problem checking in without me, but when she called Expedia, they strightened it out. The room was very comfortable and large enough for the most dicriiminating traveler. The views spectacular and even though we were opposite the elevator the room was very quiet. The shower was really strong and everything worked. The shower curtain needed a bit of adjustment or there would be water on the floor, but I am pleased that they have kept up the quality of the marble.
I would definately return to the Mark. Its a lovely way to see SFO
review.negativeRemarks: The Top, and the fact that the breakfast was a club
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Fun
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time. Everyone was friendly and very happy. Would definitely return.
review.negativeRemarks: Very awkward to pour water into the coffee pot. Should be more out in the open.

review.title: Terrific!
review.reviewText: A perfect experience. Friendly staff, terrific location, and a very comfortable bed. A swing band was playing the night I visited the Top of the Mark, and the dance floor was packed. Be sure to visit the nearby Grace Cathedral to view its beautiful stained glass windows. The Cable Car Powerhouse is just a couple of blocks away and is fascinating; you can view the 4 active cables that pull all of the cars in town.

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and SUPER nice staff - from the front desk who checked us in early, to the front door man who was always fighting to open a door for us. The hotel is older so the bathrooms are smaller and the walls a little thin. But - it is super clean and very nicely decorated and as I already said - super nice staff! We really enjoyed our time there! And for the price we paid through expedia - outstanding!!
review.positiveRemarks: It gave me the impression of being "Grand"
review.negativeRemarks: Need benches or a seperate area to smoke instead of just standing out front.
review.locationRemarks: On a steep hill, but only a block from where cable cars stop for pick up. Really easy to get to anywhere.

review.title: Very nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, the only thing it is on the top of the hill so be prepared for that. But other than that it is a clean, beautiful and the bed was amazing.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: great hotel and we had a great experience there. once we booked, i called to request a king bed, and to be away from the elevators and on a higher floor, and they had that all ready for us when we checked in. the hotel is a little older, but i guess it's more about history than being modern at the hotel. even the fairmount accross the street is the same way. the area has a lot of history, so i can see why they don't want to change up too much. mark hopkins has a great staff and top notch service. all the workers there take care of u.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the staff and concierges there. They took great care of us.
review.locationRemarks: very nice area, just tough to get by foot to being on top of the hill.

review.title: A classic
review.reviewText: A traditional classic best when getting a deal. Small-ish rooms that are impeccably kept. Few food choices--either in the hotel or nearby on the top of Nob Hill. But, go to the breakfast buffet for good food and an incredible view!

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText:
Staff is friendly, rooms are clean. You don't feel cattle like the bigger hotel.
Rooms are little small, bathroom is small. The wall of the hotel is thin you can hear when your neighbor is flushing their toilet. Our room was facing the street so it noisey specially in the morning. You can hear the trolly, car honking. The room was clean and price was reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls and noise level
review.locationRemarks: close to major attraction in sf

review.title: Great find!
review.reviewText:
We started here for 3 days. The restaurant was great, our room was really nice and the staff was exceptional. We were traveling with our one year old and they supplied us with baby toiletries and even a cute teddy bear. All requests we made of the staff were met with prompt attention and a very courteous attitude.
We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms are great, but do not eat at the Top of the Mark restaurant. Only a breakfast buffet and the food was not that good.
review.negativeRemarks: Top of the Mark is great for drinks - do not eat there.

review.title: Priceless
review.reviewText: When I checked in I was informed that the hotel was sold out....since I had pre-paid they had to give me a room.... I was told that I would have to be upgraded to a luxury suite and for any inconvenience that breakfast at Top of The Mark was on them.... It made the mini vacation I planned for my boyfriends birthday something we will always remember!!!

review.title: WOW!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience every turn, something new and wonderful, the staff were all GREAT, the bar at the top and great cocktails, food and jazz band, just a totally great time! You must go and experience it! AWESOME, and by far the best place EVER!

review.title: Historic and Pleasing
review.reviewText: The hotel is historic and located in the nob hill area and has a very classic feel to it. The rooms are on the small size but the beds are comfortable and the food in the dining room was delicious and well priced.

review.title: Happy at Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Stayed for a conference and loved the convenience, ambience, lovely hotel and staff.
review.locationRemarks: perfect, love hiking the steep hills and being close to restaurants, nice walk to ferry building and all modes of transportation if needed.

review.title: Nice SF propery
review.reviewText: Great location - nice hotel. Well appointed rooms and friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, clean rooms, well appointed (love the keurig inclusion). Fantastic views of the city
review.negativeRemarks: Hate to say it, but terrible pillows - too soft - need to include more in a room

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel.. great experience, went for conference, Rooms are bit small buy cozy. Great staff as well, Foods great. Top of the Mark has a great martini bar .. Love it !!!

review.title: World Class - Mark Hopkins will not disappoint!
review.reviewText: World class service and attention to detail. Staff was attentive and everyone seemed anxious to provide a positive experience

review.title: Excellent Hotel
