review.reviewText: Wonderful Hotel!!!! Only downside room by elevator is very, very, very noisy.

review.title: Lovely classic luxury hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, if you like the classic old school luxury hotel. Staff very respectful and polite.
rooms nice, beds a bit soft but great linens. Kerig in room a nice touch. A bit noisy but we are close to the cable cars. Felt very safe around this area. It is a steep walk to hotel if you like to walk, but union square and downtown shopping are fairly close. Right on cable car line if you prefer the fun way to travel. Great view for 'Top of the Mark', even if you don't eat there.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Compared to other 4 star hotel I stayed in San Francisco, this one is at least as good as the others (definitely better than Parc 55 or Hilton Financial District). The Westin St. Francis is better, but way more expensive. Nothing exciting, but a pleasant stay. Plus you do some exercise every day, when you walk uphill.
review.negativeRemarks: Limited capacity and slowness of the elevators
review.locationRemarks: Quite nice, loved it

review.title: Amazing service at an incredible location!
review.reviewText:
You just can't go wrong when choosing InterContinental Hotels, really. This property is greatly located at the top of Nob Hill, one of the main cable car intersections. Keep this in mind, walking all the way up can be a bit of a challenge but an enjoyable stroll anyway.
Don't forget to have a drink at The Top of the Mark, it is really worth it. You'll get an amazing view of the city in a super comfortable bar. Hope you'll enjoy as much as we did!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the reception and the Xmas decoration
review.negativeRemarks: Mmhh... a self-inflicted walk up to the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Outstanding!

review.title: SFO City Break
review.reviewText: Good for a city break. Top of the Mark bar had friendly service and great views.

review.title: Mostly good
review.reviewText: The service at the Top of the Mark was horrible. Everything else was fine
review.negativeRemarks: Service at the Top of the Marki
review.locationRemarks: Great views but it is a killer to climb back up the hill once you are done with your activities for the day

review.title: Good location, comfortable stay
review.reviewText:
Good location, nice views, this was a comfortable stay. Only downside was the rooms looked old. The location is convenient 5 min walk from Chinatown and maybe 20-30 min walk to fisherman's wharf. Convenient buses are located a couple blocks away.

When you check in ask for a map and a bus route map. It'll save you a bunch of money if you take buses instead of taxis.

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Good hotel with beautiful views. Only drawbacks are: (1) it is on top of the highest hill in the city which means great views but walking is very hard; (2) very overpriced extras. Otherwise it is great!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive extras, steep hill walking
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Love the Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Absolutely exquisite hotel...love it so much that I stay here every time I come to San Francisco. Lovely ambience, safety assured, quality without any airs. I also love the location and the ability to exercise on the steep hills, hotel close to Chinatown, I can walk to Ferry building or Fisherman's wharf. (long way but love it). Trolleys and taxis available if needed. Can't say enough good things - fabulous staff without being intrusive. I will return again and again!
review.locationRemarks: Love it all.

review.title: Room for Improvement
review.reviewText: For the price of this hotel, the service (with the exception of food and beverage- room service) was less than stellar. The card entries lock systematically which is a security issue; the organization of reservations needs room for improvement; and general flight information- call the airlines yourself. I love the view and the neighborhood, but will not be returning.

review.title: Terrific, classic old san francisco hotel in real (not tourist) neighborhood w cable car access
review.reviewText: This is a great, low-key but beautiful historic hotel in a wonderful, authentic sf neighborhood. We always like to stay here when we visit sf.

review.title: Special Bday Weekend
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, great location, trolley stop right outside hotel. Very close to China Town. In the heart of a lot of differnent places. We will be back again and this will be our number one choice hotel! Excellent Customer Service!! Thank you for making our birthday weekend special :)

review.title: Nice, but Definitely not kid friendly!!!
review.reviewText:
Overall, the hotel was very nice. The view from Top of the Mark can't be beat. However, I was so put off by the snobbery. I stayed with my two well behaved children. When we went to the restaurant in the morning, a child's buffet was $17. I am not opposed to spending money in a nice hotel, but I also don't like throwing it away. My children would have probably eaten a scrambled egg each, and I just couldn't justify it. When I told the waiter we would just have hot cocoas and enjoy the view, the waiter hastily pulled away all of our silverware and napkins, obviously put off. There were plenty of tables up there, so its not like we were taking away business. It was just rude!!
When we got outside the hotel, my son stepped out onto the driveway. I was right behind him, but the doorman told him rudely, "this is not a playground!". I paid as much as anyone, and they should not be so rude. If my children were beasts, I would understand. They just obviously are snooty!!

review.title: Too stuffy for me.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel on a "unnamed 3 star hotel" deal on Expedia. The listed price was great, but they neglect to tell you that there is a $51 per day parking charge on top of the room price. On top of that, the hotel is swarming with bell hops, etc. with their hands out every-time you walk by. The hotel made me very uncomfortable. I wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Mark Hopkins struggles to uphold a grand tradition but mostly succeeds
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel and location. Services are limited - no real restaurant or gift shop, mediocre room service. Low prices mean a tourist-hotel experience in a grand-hotel atmosphere. Elevators are super crowded. I would go back but I would also look at the Fairmont, Huntington, and Stanford Court for luxury-hotel bargains in the same part of San Francisco.

review.title: Very old and dated hotel. Not worth the money
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and dated. The lobby is good and well maintained. But when we got out of the elevator, the situation changed. The hallway had a very bad odor and carpet was torn. Got in to the room. Room was small and the bathroom was really small. You can get either boiling hot water OR cold water from faucet...nothing in between. The worst part was, the toilet had pressurized flush, but when you flush the toilet, it splashes water out of the toilet. The room was very noisy. You can hear all the road noise and noise from cable car. The bed had some hair and the comforter was ripped. Don't waste your money on this hotel.

review.title: Fabulous stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, great location and great views. Would absolutely stay there again!

review.title: Nice Hotel, not very accomodating staff
review.reviewText: After forking out an arm and a leg for this four star hotel, they did not have two beds available in a room. I was on a business trip and my adult daughter and niece. The Hotel staff said only a king bed was available. I tried to get any other room with two beds but they said there were none. So they charged me extra for a roll away bed. I think I was probably the only Hotel guest staying at a four star Hotel at stuffy Nobb Hill near Union Square on a crappy roll away bed.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay, wonderful breakfast buffet - loved our rooms view! Nob Hill is such a nice area.

review.title: Super Location
review.reviewText: We were in the heart of everything but not to close to over-crowded or noisy areas. Service was exemplary. We also received helpful advice on the best way to get around own.

review.title: Great quality for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and convenient to lots of eating places. The breakfast buffet was a nice touch and helped with budgeting. The staff was nice and accommodated our requests throughout our stay. The full kitchen was also a plus to have.

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The InterContinental Mark Hopkins is a wonderful hotel in a great location. The cable car is right outside the door. It has a wonderful history which adds to the ambiance. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are very comfortable (I had a regular room, not top of the line), and the service was excellent. A nice feature is the hotel on the top floor -- Top of the Mark. It, too, has a wonderful history, not to mention the fabulous views. We watched the 4th of July fireworks from the restaurant. Food was very good. I highly recommend it.

review.title: Love The Mark Hopkins!
review.reviewText: The beds are super comfy. The hotel is very classy, with all the old school charm. The location is central to everything. The Top of the Mark has great views at night (and wonderful martinis). We love the Mark Hopkins!

review.title: Perfect Location, Great Views
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with incredibly kind staff. The location is perfect making it easy to get around the city via walk,cable car, or taxi. We will continue to stay here for all of San Francisco trips! Don't forget to visit 'The Top of the Mark' - classic S.F. history.

review.title: Great Hotel but rooms need updating!
review.reviewText:
Great hotel with fantastic service. Check in was very easy and very welcoming. We were given an option to upgrade our room which was slightly bigger and had a better view. This was for a small fee but we were happy to pay for it as we were there for both our birthdays. We were given a room on the 15th Floor and I must admit... the view was PHENOMENAL!! We had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, San Fran Bay and the Cathedral on Nob Hill.

Hotel Service was exceptional. We arrived to our room after a short outing to find a suprise in our room. The Check In Attendant had organised a platter with a birthday Cake (Lemon Meringue Tart), chocolates, berries & Srawberries, a solid Chocolate in the shape of the Hotel and a personalised birthday card from the Hotel Staff. We were so overwelmed as my husband only mentioned our birthdays in passing. We did not expect the hotel staff to do anything let alone this beautiful suprise for us. We felt very special.

The only downsides to the hotels are: the room amenities needed some upgrading. Examples are: very old analogue TVs in the room where other hotels have Flat Screen Digital TVs. They had a outdated CD player on the bed side table instead of an iPod Docking Station. Other than that the room was BEAUTIFUL.

Overall, this was a beautiful hotel with GREAT staff... we would defiantely stay there again.

review.title: Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The only negative about staying on Nob Hill is the shortage of parking, and the resulting parking prices. There is a nearby garage on Jones St. if you don't want to pay a steep fee at the hotel or parking garages.

review.title: Dated hotel
review.reviewText: Needs updating. Ridiculous $17 wifi charge.

review.title: Good for short stay
review.reviewText: The mark was conveient in location and had everything necessary for a short trip, includding the Top of the Mark, where you can pop in for drinks or light dinner (closes tooearly though). Good view from even lower floor rooms as the hotel is situated at the top of Nob Hill.

review.title: Best weekend of my life!
review.reviewText: It was my first time going to a Giants game at ATT Park in San Francisco, and I got this amazing deal for flight and room at the Hopkins. Had one of the better weekends of my life because of the Hopkins. After watching a walk off win for the Giants, I was able to meet my hero Barry Bonds at the Top of the Mark bar in the hotel. Didnt have any problems the whole weekend with the hotel. Would definately go back and stay there. Thank you to the Mark Hopkins. Can't wait to come back!

review.title: Scenic
review.reviewText: Nice upscale hotel in SF. The views are remarkable.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff, The Top of The Mark was fun, would definitely stay at this hotel again….

review.title: It's fine
review.reviewText: I would recommend it but if i were to go again, i would choose a closer hotel than this to union square

review.title: Good view, but lacking in several areas
review.reviewText: Main complaint is there is no espresso bar in the hotel or in the neighborhood. The only breakfast choice is an overpriced buffet ($35 with tax and mandatory tip) in the Top of the Mark bar. The parking fee was an outrageous $75 per day. Another complaint is the bathroom. It has been updated, but it is tiny. With a pedestal sink and a glass shelf about two inches wide, there was no place to put anything.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel but not worth all the extra costs. No free wireless unless you are spending money in the restaurant. We couldn't even print Alcatraz tickets without paying. Our room's window was frosted. When we stood on the chair to see the view, we saw pipes. It was very dark and sad! We were not able to get the 2 queen beds and this complicated our stay and added an extra cost for the rollaway bed. There was no one to open the door of the hotel or help with luggage at any time of the day or night.

review.title: Old hotel, nice local with great rooftop views.
review.reviewText: Firstly, my expedia experience was hoorible. Checking in completely exhausted and wet (bad storm) with my teenage daughter and tMark Hopkins hotel had no reservation for us. Somehow expedia had never contacted them although they charged my credit card for two nights in full at the Intercontinental. I had to call expedia and stand at the front desk soaked for over 20 minutes until it was resolved. I was told my expedia that I was to receive a voucher for my next travel which of course never happened as well. The hotel istself was old and average with outrageous car parking prices, but the location in Nob Hill was great, the price was right and the views from their rooftop bar were wonderful.

review.title: Not worth it
review.reviewText: They don't tell you that they charge you $57 for parking, until you're ready to pick up your car. I know it's in the writing somewhere but come on, that's a rip off. Maybe $20 would be fair. The hotel room was the smallest I've ever seen. The bathroom was so small you could barely open the door without hitting the toilet. Overall, I was not impressed. Next time I'll stay at the Fairmont.

review.title: One of San Francisco's finest!
review.reviewText: Located atop Nob Hill, and with at least three generations of presence and service to travelers, the Mark Hopkins is truly a landmark. Access to surrounding parts of The City is easy and convenient. Some of us have been returning here for over 60 years, and have memories of grand events there. Expedia was a big help in locating rooms and rates which were attractive to this visitor. In this age of Internet and WiFi, I was a little surprised to see a daily charge for hooking up. Despite the high cost of staying in San Francisco, this stay at the Mark was a joy, and another memorable event.

review.title: To be determined...........
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is still in pretty good condition but the rooms and the infrastructure have aged considerably over the years. This is apparent from the HVAC system, as well as the decor inside. I love the location here in SF, but wasn't that impressed with the current state at the Top of the Mark. The management group needs to let ownership know that significant capital improvements are necessary to retain good, longstanding customers like me. Not sure if I would come back again.

review.title: GOOD HOTEL...WOULD DEF COME BACK AGAIN IF PRICE IS RIGHT!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice. As soon as you arrive at their entrance you know there's alot of history to this place. The check in was convenient and staff was very helpful. I got a an excellent rate on this so i guess that is why my room was at a lower level floor (4th flr) instead of higher up. I did take a chance and asked the check in staff whether they can change us to a higher floor with a better view. They said they could upgrade me for an add'l 20/day..which i declined but anyway they had nothing available. The rooms are very nice good size with big bathroom. 1st nite, after a full day out, we came home and ran the shower..pulled on the shower handle, it came off... came out and pulled on the bathroom handle, it came off also. It was quite funny actually but we called downstairs and they sent someone up with 5 minutes to fix it...it was fine..it's an hold historical hotel..it happens. The bathroom is very nice but beware there is absolutely no water pressure in the shower but then the toilet will suck a small child in..go figure! The hotel is within 3 blocks to chinatown and union square..very convenient. but you must hike up hill back to the hotel..I work out 3-4 x per week ( hi intensity cardio and toning) and i was tired from the hike. We went for breakfast buffet at "the top of the mark". ..it cost 35 per person...and it was a complete rip off and TOTALLY not worth it..so save your money and go outside for b/fast or go to basement of fairmont hotel.

review.title: departure stay
review.reviewText: room and bathroom were consistant with price

review.title: Prime Time San Fran
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, located in a great area of the City with a suberb staff. I got in early and they allowed my to check in at 1:00 pm. which I appreciated after traveling. They also arranged for a car with a knowledgable driver. The Top of the Mark is a very nice way to end an evening. The view from the room was beautiful and the floor quiet. I was in the City for a speaking engagement and actually arrived at the conference well-rested the next day. Only negative, and it is a small one, is the large conference (not the one I was attending) that the hotel was hosting during my stay.

review.title: US Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is extremely nice. The staff were helpful and the rooms were very clean however the hotel needs major renovation, it looks and feels old. The restaurant was well below my expectation

review.title: top of the mark
review.reviewText: Hotel room was nice and spacious with a nice view. The room was quiet and everything worked. It's a short walk to all of the shopping and Union Square. Parking is pricey at the hotel and near the hotel. The only thing that was disappointing is that the Top of the Mark was fully booked and you couldn't get in without a reservation. I had reservations but cancelled since we were going to stay at the hotel. Doh! We wanted to dance and luckily the Tonga Room is right across the street from the Hopkins and was open the entire time we were there.

review.title: Historic SF with a Modern Feel
review.reviewText:
Great location - right on the cable car line. It is a historic old hotel that doesn't show any wear and tear. Great view, especially from the "Top of the Mark" restaurant on the top floor. Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable room. I'll definitely stay there again next time I'm in SF.

It's a little way off Market, but your concierge can steer you to some great restaurants in the neighborhood. Since its on the top of the hill, I wouldn't recommend walking there from the Bart. However, if you are travelling light and like to walk, it's just a quick roll downhill to the Bart stop on your way back to the airport.

review.title: I'll be staying here again...
review.reviewText: This is a really nice hotel at the very top of Nab Hill. I stopped by the Mark Hopkins a few hours before the official check-in time to see if I could leave my bag there while I looked around the city. The guys at the front desk was able to do an early check-in instead which was REALLY helpful. The (corner) room and view I had was really nice. The beds were comfortable, the lighting great but the showers water pressure was pretty low. The cable cars all cross in front the hotel so get a MUNI passport (unless you want a major workout walking up the REALLY steep hills). Overall a great hotel. I'll be staying here next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Old world elegance.
review.reviewText: Great rooms. We upgraded to a suite which was even more magnificent. Only complaint was the maid service never replaced our used coffee mugs, or restocked the coffee grinds we used. We had to keep calling to have things brought up to us.

review.title: Good location. No need to rent a car
review.reviewText:
I stayed in the Mark Hopkins during the thanks giving week and it was very good. It is located very close to a cablecar station and within a walking distance to several activities. The hotel is a bit old but it is well maintained. Parking is very expensive ($50 per night) as in anywhere in San Francisco but you can get away without renting a car if you are just doing San Francisco or even taking a cab, it would cost $9-11 going to the piers which is the same for two persons in the cable car.
In summary, we enjoyed our stay and I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Pleasant stay at hotel in Nob Hill
review.reviewText:
We were verbally welcomed to the hotel every time we returned.
The room was very clean and the view on to the main street was very nice as I had a corner room.
Room service was prompt and delivered when they said they would. The server forgot one of our drinks and quickly returned with two extra drinks to make up for the inconvenience.
Hotel is one block from Powell where one can catch the cable car leading to Fisherman's Wharf.
We found the staff at this hotel to be extremely helpful and friendly.
We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Pricey, but worth a splurge
review.reviewText: Although we got a great rate on the rooms, parking and other services at the hotel were not cheap. However, we had a great visit, so would consider staying there again -- at least knowing about the other expenses in advance.

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: This is obviously a old hotel, but it has been refurbished nicely. Staff was great and food was scrumptious. Unfortunately, our conference accommodations outside the lecture setting were very crowded. This was partly due to the fact we had more attendees than expected, but also because the hotel wasn't really designed for this type of conference with several poster presentations and exhibitors.

review.title: a little pricey and old but clean and nice location
review.reviewText:
a little pricey and old but clean and nice location

fitness center could a major overhaul

tv was ancient

review.title: lovely
review.reviewText: beautiful and historic!

review.title: Would recommend hotel just not sure I would go back for reasons below.
review.reviewText:
The things that were disappointing to us were; the elevators much to small so that
when the hotel was busy you had to wait to long to get up or down, no restaurant in the hotel that you could go into for a full breakfast off a menu rather than always having the buffet which most of the time although the food was good was never really hot enough to enjoy. Also, if you decide to stay and have lunch or dinner at the hotel if you did not want to go out that was not an option.
The Top of the Mark was wonderful with a fabulous view of Nob Hill. The entertainment was great as well. They do cater to the large groups, conventions and business class, so if that is what you are looking for that is perfect.

review.title: Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: Great classic hotel on Nob Hill. The Top of the Mark is a classic place to have a cocktail and enjoy 360 degree views of the city and bay below. Nice spacious room with soft freshly made beds. Breakfast included in the rate was a plus since the buffet style breakfast which was top notch costs $35 with gratuity/svc. charge.

review.title: One of the best hotels we've stayed at.
review.reviewText: We would recommend this hotel to anyone that was headed to San Francisco. The location is perfect; easy to get around to other parts of the city, either walking or taxi. The veiw from the Top of The Mark is breathtaking, including cocktails. We would definetly stay at the Mark Hopkins the next time we are in the city.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Very Small rooms and bathroom. Very old amenities (TV, coffee maker-which hadn't been cleaned well.) Business center expensive. Concierge and staff were great. Nice old ambiance.

review.title: Sadly Disappointed
review.reviewText:
My wife ad I traveled here for a getaway trip for the weekend. We were looking forward to having a great time and an equally great of a stay in the Mark Hopkins. Unfortunately, we would be sadly disappointed. We paid for an upgraded room on the 17th floor. Unfortunately, the hotel's bar/club was only two floors above and we were kept awake by the loud music until 12:30 every night we were there. On top of that, the walls were paper thin and we listened to a guy next door who we swore was going to cough up a lung. This coughing fit went on for at least an hour and a half every night as well.

The beds were not very comfortable and the pillows didn't provide much support for your head at all. My wife and I had extreme difficulties getting any kind of restful sleep during our stay.

The AC unit in the room wouldn't turn on until it was at least 5 degrees above the temperature we set it at, and when you tried to over-ride it and put the fan on it would only stay on for a minimum amount of time. Needless to say, my wife and I were up and down countless times during the night turning it back on because the room became very warm, esepcially the weekend we were there which they had temperatures in the 80's!

When we checked out and I told the front desk agent about our issues he looked at me and aid "oh well." I was so offended and couldn't beleive the horrible service we had received. We probably will not be staying at this hotel ever again.

review.title: First Rate
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Comfortable beds.

review.title: Great hotel and fantastic breakfast at the top of the mark
review.reviewText:
I enjoy older hotels with a great location and class. This matches the criteria.
The view and breakfast at the top of the mark was really a treat. The room was
as expected: clean, well appointed and a pleasant place to stay.

review.title: Landmark Hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is quite old now and is not quite as luxurious as in its heyday. However the service is excellent and the rooms are very comfortable and clean
and well equipped. It ias in a central location but at the summit of quite a steep hill and might be too much for older travellers. However I enjoyed my time there very much. The Top of the Mark cocktail bar has a wonderful panoramic view of the city and harbour. It is an ikon of this city and I would go back any time I was going to San Francisco with or without flowers in my hair

review.title: Not so top of the mark.
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a smart base and find a good rate on Expedia then this is a good hotel. However, for a hotel of this standard there were several things I would have expected which weren't included in the room rate. Don't expect the modern perks of a City hotel. For example, WiFi was chargeable at $16 for 24hours, which I thought was extortianate given that most coffee shops and even the most basic motels provide wifi these days. Secondly, we had no where near enough towels for a double occupancy and there was only one bath robe in the room. A small detail but it all added up to make you feel that corners were cut. Expect to wait for the lifts for a fair while too.

review.title: Great time @ the Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Staying at the InterContinental Mark Hopkins was a fantastic experience. The Hotel's location is ideal for first time visitors, everything was really close by, and several cable car routes pass right by the hotel. It is a safe neighborhood to walk by night. I did not get to experience the food and the view from the Top of the Mark, because it was closed. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, and will definitely choose it myself again.

review.title: Great location and view
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Very pleasent San Francisco hotel experience
review.reviewText: Our room was larger than we expected. It was well decorated and very comfortable. The bed was probably the best hotel bed I have ever experienced. The staff were all very friendly quite helpful. If walking, be prepared to traverse some major hills. There are readily available cabs and cable cars if one does not want to tackle the steep inclines on foot. Also be prepared for parking cost if one has a vehicle . I recommend taking the time to go to the "Top of the Mark". It provides a beautiful view of the city.

review.title: Would go back in a heart beat.
review.reviewText: Like it so much we stayed an extra day and paid the full rate.

review.title: 4 star with 2 star service
review.reviewText: Service promised but never delivered!

review.title: MArk Hopkins
review.reviewText: This hotel was really a top end hotel with modern luxury. Upon check in my bags were brought to my room for me and was shown around the hotel where things were free of charge which was nice. The room was great with an awesome view of the city and bay. The only complaint is that it said it had HD tv with hookups in every room. Mine however did not have a HD anything and wireless internet was 24.95 to use and wired about 10. Also there was not a pool or hot tub but there was a great free gym. Overall though it was worth the money.

review.title: Very top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic.

review.title: The Top of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a fine hotel and it is centrally located. Plan on leaving your car in the garage, or better yet, take a cab to the hotel. This part of San Francisco is best viewed from cable car or on foot.

review.title: Mark Hopkins - SF
review.reviewText: Historic hotel in a wonderful part of San Francisco. I would go back in a heart beat!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed 6 days and it was great.
The hotel is very nice. The room is very spacious and the bed was very comfortable
We rented a car with the concierge and the service was great. The staff was very friendly.
We stayed at a 2nd floor and we could hear the calbe car the whole night until 12am. I would recomend to stay at a upper level.

review.title: Great escape from busy tourist areas!
review.reviewText: We usually stay in Union Square area, but decided to get away from the crowds and be closer to Russian Hill, where family lives. This hotel is usually out of our price range, but had a good weekend rate. Loved the hotel and neighboorhood - right in the middle of Russian Hill, Union Square, and Embarcadero! We love to walk and were able to walk everywhere.

review.title: Great Hotel but bar/restaraunt disappointing
review.reviewText: Great hotel for weekend get away with good rates. Was disappointed when we went to the Top of The Mark for afternoon drinks and could not get a clean table to sit at or get waited on. Left without getting a drink and decided to go elsewhere for our nice evening dinner. With the poor economy I would expect better service.

review.title: loved everything but the old beds
review.reviewText:
i had stayed at the Mark Hopkins many times over the last twenty years.
Even though I hadn't been there in quite some time the hotel was still lovely and the service was good. Our only complaint was that the beds were not very comfortable. My friend described her bed as "lumpy" while mine was more bumpy. It was squishy on one side and firm on the other with a big dip in the center that made it a little difficult to find a comfortable place to settle in.

review.title: Eat at the Fairmont
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, the only place to eat in the hotel in the evenings is the Top of the Mark. They are often busy with a line of non-residents and very rigid about keeping a formal seating policy: You must be seated by the hostess, which may mean you wait a long time for her when she is nowhere to be found. I want to thank the hostess on duty during my stay for being so absent and then, upon her return, so busy with other matters, that I ended up having a wonderful meal across the street at the Fairmont.

review.title: Staying at a San Francisco historic landmark
review.reviewText:
This is it. A classic Art Deco masterpiece. A San Francisco historic landmark and San Francisco's best location, Nob Hill.

The hotel is immaculate and very well run and the views are spectacular.

A wonderful experience and very good value.

review.title: San Fran Hopkins!!!
review.reviewText: The Mark Hopkins Hotel is by far the best hotel we have stayed at in quite some time. It was our honeymoon and everyone from the waitstff on the 19th floor to the concierge were extremely helpful and warm. We had a blast and the view from our room on the 11th floor to the morning breakfasts on the 19th floor were beyond words. I can't wait for another trip. Thank you!!!

review.title: Nice but....
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but the restaurant is extremely expensive and they charge for Internet access. Not really near much considering it is near the downtown. Nice place for a an expensive romantic introduction to San Francisco, as it is near cable cars. Not recommended for pragmatic business travellers.

review.title: Must experience Top of the Mark Bar lounge
review.reviewText: I've lived in San Francisco for over 10 years and always wanted to stay or visit Mark Hopkins. I wanted to check their famous Top of the Mark Bar & Cocktail Lounge. Stunning views. It was quite experience and recommend everyone to go there while you're in town.

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText:
We would absolutely return to the Mark Hopkins in San Francisco. The hotel services are top notch. Our only slight disappointment was the Top of the Mark restaurant (top of the hotel). Although beautiful, the dining service for lunch was so poor, we walked out. The doorman sent us to another restaurant around the corner that was wonderful, so it all turned out just fine. So, stay at the Mark Hopkins, and just do not plan on eating lunch at the Top of the Mark. Perhaps dinner service is better.

You'll will love the warm welcome to San Francisco!

review.title: Beautiful, not convenient.
review.reviewText: The price was good for a beautiful property, but the lack of a basic restaurant for breakfast, a gift shop to grab a soda, or a pool or spa were drawbacks. The Top of the Mark was the only option for brunch on the weekend, for $60 per person.

review.title: Elegant, historic hotel
review.reviewText: Inter Mark Hopkins is a beautiful hotel adjacent to two trolley lines. The bed was large, fluffy and extremely comfortable; the bathroom was average size and accommodates two people at the wash basin. Reception, bell and valet staff polite and accomodating. The hotel is located on a hill, thus walking to Union Square (5 block away) may pose a challenge on the uphill climb, but the Powell trolley stops at the corner on Powell/California intersection. Valet only parking expensive but expected for San Francisco.

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great location. They helped our party get transportation to places in the City.

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText:
We had a fabulous stay at the Mark Hopkins.
The staff was extremely polite, courtesy and helpful.
We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Wayne
review.reviewText: Beautiful, classic hotel in classy neighborhood. Great views and ambiance. My favorite in San Francisco.

review.title: A Great Old Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed the weekend in San Francisco to see Cirque du Soleil. The hotel is in a perfect SF location 'a top' of Nob HIll with splendid views, especially from their marquis restaurant and bar "The top of the Mark". The room was spacious and comfortable with all the usual amenities. The only issue was loud noises coming from what seemed to be the building's plumbing. This is a wonderful hotel with a courteous staff which could easily be a five star if they did some much needed modernizing. I would still recommend it. If you stay here request a northernly facing room, much better views.

review.title: not intercontinental quality!
review.reviewText: was initially impressive from the outside and the environs, however the hotel was dated and only superficially high quality. Rooms are extremely tight - our first room's bathroom was so tiny you couldn't comfortably close the door and go to the bathroom. However, the front desk was open to changing our rooms without any question. Our second room had a cigarette odor lingering. The heavier drapes would not close, so only gauze-y white drapes covered our windows that looked across into other people's hotel rooms, and let in sunlight in the morning. Bottom line, not the same quality hotel as expected for an intercontinental hotel. As an aside, not the hotel's fault, but being on such a steep hill, naturally we took many cabs to and from the hotel, however the cabs were rude and many refused to take me unless I was going a long distance. More of a problem if you are unwilling to deal with the steep hill.

review.title: Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel has class written on it, from th ebuilding its location and the staff. We did not use the restaurant so cannot comment on this aspect. Room service meals were of a good standard, were hot and well presented.

review.title: Concerning light sleepers
review.reviewText:
If you are unlucky enough to be next to some inconsiderate neighbors, you may be surprised at how much noise gets through to your room. If you are a light sleeper, this can be a problem.
I spent about thirty miserable, late night minutes listening to some moronic woman blabbing incessantly before resorting to some prudently packed earplugs.
Other than that, I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Just Beautiful
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, felt like a celebrity. Views from room were serene. Very modern and clean, within blocks of Union Square.

review.title: dono
review.reviewText: something sould be done about $50 parking and no free internet in rooms.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great service
review.reviewText: Stayed for 4 days at the Mark Hopkins and it was a treat. Room was small but very nice and very clean. Service was excellent as everything was taken care of and attendents were very helpful. Parking next store was expensive but very convenient. Top of the Mark is very cool bar. Made for a very nice stay.

review.title: NOT anything like the Fairmont!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Mark Hopkins for a week right after Thanksgiving because the Fairmont (across the street) was booked solid. My wife and I thought - "Hey, it's a 4 star hotel right across the street from the Fairmont!" It should be as nice as the Fairmont, right? WRONG!!!

We have no idea how it got a 4 star rating. The hotel doesn't even have a gift shop / store for small necessities. The room was sooooo small. It didn't have a dresser, only had 2 half drawers and 1 full size drawer. We found out that the only rooms that had dressers were the suites. I couldn't get out of the bed without hitting the chair & ottoman next to the bed. This hotel still have the old tube TV's. No flat panels. Even if you paid through the nose and stayed on the very top floor, you would not have a clear view of the bay because the Fairmont is in its line of sight.

This would be a 3 star business hotel in my book - similar to a Marriott.

review.title: Pretender not a contender
review.reviewText: Postage stamp size room and large furniture made an uncomfortable stay. Old noisy water pipes clanked during the night. Service was poor. Forty five minutes to get the car from valet. The Mark is nowhere near what it used to be.

review.title: Mark Hopkins has gone down.
review.reviewText: Mark Hopkins cleanliness and maintenance has gone down since the last time we were there. Staff, however, is friendly and helpful.

review.title: It's not bad
review.reviewText: The hotel is at great location if you don’t mind the hill. You can easily catch the cable car at bottom of the hill, and it drops you off right by the hotel. Union square and China town are very close in walking distance. The concierge and bellman were great. The front desk sometimes was a little slow. During the week days, the hall way is getting pretty noisy in the early morning.

review.title: Expected More
review.reviewText: This is the Mark Hopkin's right? I don't know what happened to friendly service but that didn't exist. The gentleman at the front desk acted as if we were lucky to have him check us in. I also recommend that if you have ANY special requests whatsoever, that you call the hotel and do not rely on the reservation form area where you fill in the requests. The front desk clerks do not review this nor did ours attempt to make things happen for us. Bummed since I've stayed at this hotel before and expected superior service.

review.title: There are much nicer and quieter places to stay
review.reviewText: I get the impression that times are hard for The Mark and they are simply selling rooms to anyone with enough pooled money to rent them. The atmosphere this visit was not relaxed at all and the patronage was very tourist class in terms of what I saw coming and going here. This was my second visit to The Mark and the first visit was a few years back. I had a room on the CA street side and it was noisy from early morning bar patrons exiting the hotel bar onto the street-VERY NOISY when I visited before. This time I requested a room off the street and ended up with a rooftop view of the A/C unit with a closet that had wet carpeting smelling of cat pee. The walls between the rooms were so thin I had to call the front desk to ask them to please have the nearby room of partiers to settle down so I could sleep for my return flight home. The are ice machines only on a few floors so you have to venture out and fetch your own ice once you locate it. THe business center offers free boarding pass printing but the equipment kept failing to print and I had to basically stand in line at the airport afterall my wasted time. The staff is courteous at all times-no complaints. I think this hotel needs to raise prices and focus on making sure that the rooms and accomodations are equal to the reputation they have built for themselves over the years.

review.title: Wonderful place and location, accomodating group
review.reviewText: Excellent and great location, and feel at home base conditions.

review.title: Nice Hotel, but old plumbing.
review.reviewText: we stayed at this hotel for part of our honeymoon.The location is great, the room was very well appointed and clean. We were very well taken care of by the staff, particularly a gentleman named Rene. He helped with directions, recommendations on sites to see and general information - very nice to deal with. On the other hand, one major drawback was the plumbing. This is a very old building and the plumbing is horrible. Toilets took two flushes and the shower pipes produced a VERY loud shuddering noise when in use (we could hear the same noise coming from the next room). Upon checkout the person at the desk was very matter-of-fact and a bit condescending about our complaint. For this reason I connot recommend this otherwise very nice hotel.

review.title: San Fran Historic Hotels
review.reviewText: Not that impressed - rooms are very small, the halls and rooms were not that clean, staff was average and not very attentive

review.title: Grande Dame still delivers.
review.reviewText: It may not be the most contemporary or glamorous but the Mark is still a wonderfully satisfying place to stay. Lots of old-fashioned virtues here like its legendary location, truly excellent bed and pillows, courteous staff and a stately lobby. The Top of the Mark is still a fine place to have a drink and see the city but rather underwhelming as "night life."

review.title: Great location, great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is located at the top of the hill in SF, so you'll start your day climbing down the hills, and end your day climbing up. It has great views through its restaurant (Top of the Mark) and is located in a very nice and quiet area (not so many tourists walk around, although it's just a few blocks off of Union Square). The room was very nice, clean and looks renovated (as stated by the site). The only downside is that everything is a little pricey given that it's an Intercontinental hotel (however we got a promotional price for the stay, so that was great!)

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, from service to cleanliness. The only drawback was we needed a double bed room for our three children but they only had a king size bed room so we had to rent a rollaway bed. I think that should be provided at no charge since we made the request when we made the reservations that we needed a double bed for one of the rooms.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel has a friendly staff, great views (especially from the restaurant on the top floor), and it is in an extremely central location (3-4 blocks from Union Square, near many small diners/pubs). The room was always clean and it was very spacious.

review.title: Great location, small room
review.reviewText: Very beautiful hotel in a great spot. The room was quite small so don't expect to be able to unpack your bags. Would be great if they replaced the large minibar cabinet with a dresser! Front desk was helpful but not terribly friendly.

review.title: great trip
review.reviewText: great hotel can't wait to go back great location

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: My fiancee and I had a great 3 night stay at the Mark Hopkins. We loved the Nob Hill vicinity. We were able to use our car extensively to get around the city and finding parking was much easier than I would have thought for an August weekend. However, our best experiences came from moseying around by foot or by hopping on the trolley cars and getting ourselves lost within this great city. My only knock on the hotel is the absence of any vending machines. We had to walk to the hotel next door for bottled water.

review.title: Intercontinental Mark Hopkins in San Fran
review.reviewText: Very nice, historic hotel, at the top of nob hill and centrally located. The Top of the Mark, cocktail lounge, at the top of the hotel is incredible. 360 degree views of the whole city and a great martini menu. Only negative is if you book through a travel agency you will not get the amount of beds you requested. They also tack on a $60 parking fee on your bill when you check out. This, I'm sure, is pretty standard though at any of the hotels downtown.

review.title: Great Views
review.reviewText: The Mark is a lovely hotel, centrally located, it is an easy and interesting walk to Fisherman's Wharf and also down to the shopping district. Enjoyed my stay. Wonderful views from the room.

review.title: Centrally located and some great views
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel, but fairly well maintained and worth consideration. We had two rooms (same type/price) on the same floor- one was spacious and had great views, the other was cramped and bad views. So, not all rooms created equal. Higher floors are better re being away from cable car noise. Staff was reasonably acomodating. As typical for SF, parking fee is ridiculus. Centrally located, but the great views are created by being on top of one of SF's highest hills, so if you go walking everything in down hill going out and incredibly uphill coming back. Cable cars run by the front door so that is an option. Most restuarants are 4-5 blocks away. Check out the bar on top of the hotel for great view and jazz.

review.title: A big hill to climb
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel, however not the most convenient location if you want to go to the financial district or the shopping area around Union Square and the Westfield Shopping Center. The hotel is at the very top of a big hill. There are two cable cars nearby that will take you up and down the hill but in summer they are packed with people.

review.title: it was ok not fantastic and not bad just ok
review.reviewText: the front desk seemed a bit up themselves the conceirge was extremely helpful the bed was great king size and comfortable very expensive internet $10.90 for twenty minutes i wouldn't stay there again if visiting san francisco ther are better located hotels in union square which is the best place to stay

review.title: Wanted to stay longer...
review.reviewText: Our comfy, nicely-decorated room on the 15th floor was great even though it was a city and partial bay view. The bath was modern with a phone and marble vanity. Staff was very nice, especially when we had to swing by with our rental car and check out, they let us park out front for 10 minutes. Just four blocks to Chinatown and right by the trolley stop.

review.title: Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: Old style elegance with all the modern conveniences.

review.title: Hotel was wonderful
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. The only downfall is that there is only one restaurant and it can be pricy. However, since it is at the top, the view is worth at least one splurge during your stay.

review.title: Great Hotel with History
review.reviewText: My husband and I went stayed at the Mark Hopkins for our honeymoon. We were nothing but pleased with the experience. We were able to check in 4 hours early, and have a late checkout when we left with no issues. Employees was pleasant and helpful with every interaction. From our room, we could see the ocean and Alcatraz. It's a perfect location to get to Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square. We had a wonderful time!

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText: We liked our stay very much. Walking distance to union station, shopping district, restaurants and off course the famous China town. We enjoyed our tour of the city, no need to take car on your trip. Cost of parking is about half the cost of staying in the hotel. There are adequate public transportation to every where.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: We got a pretty good deal with expedia on this hotel. Older hotel, so small rooms, but nicely maintained. it is located "up-the-hill" which is nice because it the morning you can walk down to things and then just take a taxi back instead of climbing... Restaurant wasnt anything spectacular.. and $120 for appetizers and glasses of wine.....

review.title: Impressive hotel, not-so-impressive service
review.reviewText: The InterContinental Mark Hopkins is a historic and beautiful hotel. However, the chief concierge was less than impressive. She was not as knowledgeable of places to eat outside of the immediate area, and some places she recommended were not open. She could have also been a bit more friendly. The front desk staff, however, were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is walking distance to many San Francisco favorites - China Town, Little Italy, Union Square, and the Embarcadero shopping center.

review.title: A real Expedia value
review.reviewText: Extremely satisfied with my stay. Hotel is located very close to cable car access which was a joy to ride. Staff was very pleasant. Everyone was helpful in providing directions and suggestions. I plan to visit again.

review.title: mark hopkins
review.reviewText: excellent overall. location is the best in the city. peaceful yet close to everyting.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel with an amazing view
review.reviewText: The Mark Hopkins is a experience you cannot describe. The view from the hotel is beautiful. Theaters are Nearby and awesome places to eat within walking distance.

review.title: Amazingly Great Views of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Mark Hopkins is on top of Nob Hill, but it's really more like Nob Mountain. Commanding views of the whole city surround you, and from the Top of the Mark at sunset it's just simply amazing. The Penthouse Suite and sunroom suites are large and beautiful throughout, and the regular rooms are quite nice but the bathrooms are a bit on the small side for my liking (although probably to be expected in an historic hotel).

review.title: Great hotel, walk to Zingari's!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a class act. No big surprises.

review.title: Mark's is a true classic
review.reviewText: The hotel was great but the staff not so friendly!

review.title: Hits a triple
review.reviewText: The Mark Hopkins offers great hotel service, a great location where one cable car line is at the front door and the other half a block away, and the Top of the Mark where in the morning you can have a great breakfast, at night you can find entertainment, and anytime a spectacular view.

review.title: Elegant experience
review.reviewText: What an incredible value-- booking through Expedia. The hotel was elegant with a great city location. Although small, the room was comfortable and the bathroom lavish! My business traveling husband couldn't believe what I paid for an incredible weekend stay at "The Mark."

review.title: Always fun
review.reviewText: No matter how good your hotel stay is, it is in SF. Anyhow, superb location, comfy beds...

review.title: Awesome Location for our Honeymoon!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 5 nights during our honeymoon in May 2009. The hotel was wonderful, the staff were wonderful and the city is beautiful! The only negative is that bed was less comfortable than our bed at home and the sheets were not as soft as we would have expected. The room was also a bit cramped, but for the price we paid here on expedia, it was amazing!

review.title: Always a classic, friendly experience
review.reviewText: I love the Mark Hopkin's. I have stayed at the Fairmont and the Marriott in San Francisco, which are fine hotels, but the Mark is like going back home.

review.title: Very good facility
review.reviewText: Beautiful property, centrally located (if you can manage walking up and down the hill), very good service, pleasant and helpful staff.

review.title: Top of the hill and Top of my list!!!
review.reviewText: This was the second time to stay at the Mark Hopkins. From the time you walk through the front door you can tell that you made the perfect hotel choice. All the hotel staff were very nice and willing to help in any way possible.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: MH lived up to its legendary reputation.

review.title: Classic Style & Comfort
review.reviewText: One of San Francisco's classic hotels, there's no surprises...you get what you expect from the InterContinental brand. Great level of style and comfort in all the facilities, and you cannot beat the Top of the Mark for the best views in San Francisco. I do wish the front desk staff were more attentive however...not to quick to assist or even acknowledge waiting guests....bit surprising from such a hotel.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: it was a beautiful hotel except i did not get my request for king size bed since i was by myself and did not need 2nd queen size bed that occupied space. Over all it was a pleasant stay for 2 nights.

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: Staff were really friendly, very helpful

review.title: Nice Views shame about the staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated at the top of Nob Hill and its location although beautiful in terms of views, is not practical for the sightseeing tourist as the walk from the hotel to the local sights is both lenghty and steep. The rooms are very comfortable,however we waited for over and hour and a half to be given our room after arriving in San Francisco off a long flight. Needless to say we were not happy. The staff were were slightly arroagant and out of touch with the service industry.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: On both cable car routes, you can get anywhere very easy. Well kept older hotel with a sense of the old days.

review.title: Parking FEE is HORRIBLE!, HOTEL is WONDERFUL
review.reviewText: first things first, paying 53 dollars a day for parking my rental car..NOT COOL! next time i go to san fran i'm using public transportation, me and my wife loved the fact that the cable cars were right in front of the hotel. overall the hotel has that old but classic feel to it. bed was great. service was nice.

review.title: View
review.reviewText: The bar at night on the 30th floor gives a great view of San Francisco

review.title: Almost Wonderful
review.reviewText: A hotel positioned perfectly atop Nob Hill to overlook beautiful San Francisco and at an intersection of the famed cable cars to take you just about anywhere in the city you would want to go, a hotel rich with tradition and the elegance of San Francisco's heyday sounds pretty close to the "Perfect" place to stay in the City by the Bay. It was... pretty close. The staff was very warm and friendly. The room was clean and beautifully decorated. The bathroom, though finished in marble had a few problems. When the shower was turned on a thumping sound like a Harley Davidson began. It was not only in our room, for we heard it from other rooms as well. The temperature of the water in the shower would test your heart by changing from hot to ice without touching a knob! Before sitting down, it was necessary to take the tissue roll off the dispenser because it was too far away from the stool. The room had a small coffee pot with supplies for one day. We were there seven days and the supplies were refilled three times. We ordered a rental car for a days trip up to wine country and were assured by the desk that we would be called as soon as it came. They never called! If I have the good fortune to go back to San Francisco, I might choose a little less elegance.

review.title: Affordable luxury in a great location - just be prepared for late check-in
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel -- filled with character and history, but updated nicely for the 21st century. The rooms were large and comfortable. The Top of the Mark is a great restaurant, too. Our only complaint -- and it's a pretty big one -- our rooms were not only not ready when promised, they weren't ready by the time of "official" check-in. Something's amiss with the housekeeping schedule/oversight.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, the resturent view was very beautiful, the room was small.over all we had fun.

review.title: bad service
review.reviewText: although I had booked a king size room with a king size bad,the day I arrived, the hotel only has queen size rooms avaiable, with queen size beds. not big enough for 1 person, imagine for 2 people coming fm overseas... i complained showed my reservation, but it was useless, the hotel was fully booked. they just changed my room to a king size bed in my second night. I tried to talk to the manager, it was very difficult.

review.title: Classic, Comfortable Landmark
review.reviewText: Everything about the Mark Hopkins reflects its heritage as a SF landmark. Extremely comfortable beds, pillows, and ambience. Amazing views. Very kind service at "The Top" for celebratory drinks during our multi-generational reunion.

review.title: Classy and Elegant without being stuffy!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a weekend treat for me and my husband. We normally gravitate towards new and modern and this place was more historic and antique, however I still loved the luxurious ambiance! We never felt out of place, even in our jeans and tennis shoes we went to the Top of the Mark for cocktails and dessert. We could hear some people in the next room but usually we are those "loud neighbors" (we normally travel with 3 children) so we did not complain. Besides we didn't have to endure the annoyance for long. It did not ruin our stay in any way. The uphill walk back from Union Square was a bit tough but if you don't want the exercise I guess you can hail a cab!

review.title: Top Marks for the Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: What can I say, it's been a San Francisco landmark for decades. Lovingly maintained, professionally staffed, comfortable and well appointed rooms. Visit the Top of the Mark for panoramic views, excellent cocktails and dancing to live jazz on the weekends. Highly recommended.

review.title: san francisco mark hopkins
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were exceptional and the hotel is well kept and maintains high standards.

review.title: Expected More
review.reviewText: The overall hotel stay was quite OK. I had expected it to be WOW but it didnt! The service was not bad but what really disappoint me was the Top of the Mark. Maybe the place was too busy when I was there and the service was not that excellent as what I would have expected - a friend recommended me. However, I did enjoy the breakfast buffet in the morning at the same place (what a difference) - I commend on the excellent service of the waiter.

review.title: Good time
review.reviewText: Posh hotel, great location near cable car lines. You can enjoy the Top of the Mark dancing on Fri/Sat night then just saunter back to your room!

review.title: Worse Place I've Ever Stayed
review.reviewText: Hotel is very over priced for what you get. Staff was rude and snobby. Room was tiny and very noisy, all night long. Valet parking staff ruined my battery. I replaced the battery in San Francisco during the stay and they tried to ruin the second battery. Hotel management was a joke, stating the valet parking is an outside vendor, so they couldn't help. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The overall feel of the Mark Hopkins is classy and clean, but I had a few issues. First of all, I knew that when I booked through expedia that I was going to be in a room on one of the lower floors. I called to request a higher floor and was given a complimentary upgrade from the the 5th floor to the 9th floor. Although it was a bigger room, it was a smoking floor. Something I was willing to deal with to get away from the road noise. Ahhh the road noise. If you don't mind the quaint sound of the cable car most of the night, you won't have a problem, but it was substantial. That, coupled with what felt like paper-thin walls made for mostly restless nights. Another minor issue I had was the daily charge for internet use. Are you joking me? When you charge a certain premium for a room, wouldn't you expect complimentary high-speed internet. All in all. The Hop is a classy hotel with a great location, history, and service, but I was left disappointed with my overall experience.

review.title: Intercontinental Mark Hopkins Hotel
review.reviewText: There was a $50.00 a night parking fee!! Breakfast was $26.00 a person for a buffet and gratuity was added on automatically. The coolest the rooms get is 67 degrees. Internet service is $12.95 a day!! The hotel is beautiful and the views are amazing but the unforeseen costs were outrageous.

review.title: Not bad, but there is better
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. However, the rooms are small and the bed was very uncomfortable - lumpy. Also, the room is low-tech if that matters to you. Otherwise, it is very clean and well stocked.

review.title: An historic landmark
review.reviewText: Beautiful property, great views. Acceptable staff. Have weekday breakfast, not Sunday brunch, at the Top of the Mark. Concierge gave good suggestions on sightseeing. Noise of cable cars, at least from 6 stories up, was not a problem.

review.title: One of San Francisco's Best Hotels
review.reviewText: Was greeted and treated with comfort and quality service from all points of view as a traveler. The hotel is in a very good part of the city convienent to tourist sights to see as well as the cable cars and bus lines. If going without a car this is a very good hotel to stay in. Would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

review.title: Intend to return when possible
review.reviewText: My visit brought back fond memories of my very first visit to Nob Hill in the 1930's and subsequent visits troughtout the '60s and later. I was able to take my young granddaughters to the "Top of the Mark" What a thrill for and old lady!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice location, Only Make sure you do not take the room that faces the street with the cable car.Very noisy.Front desk staff behave like DMV employees.Unpleasant.

review.title: Very Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is located on the top of Nob Hill on California and Mason Streets. Trollies are located on Powell which is down the 70degree hill and another trolley which run right past the hotel. The location is clean and free of the homeless. Fairmont hotel is right across the street. The main street which is Powell will take you to Union and Market streets and in the other direction it will take you to Hyde. If you take the trolley on California you can get to China Town. This hotel is very kid friendly ...meaning the staff goes out of their way to make them comfortable. The Concierge will recommend some great restaurants which are not filled with tourists. If it wasn't for the hills I would go back to San Francisco and stay at this hotel without hesitation.

review.title: This hotel is perfect! Perfect location and Service
review.reviewText: Service and the bar are wonderful.

review.title: Our Favorite San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Absolutely first rate in every way. Great, responsive service, knowledgeable staff, terrific location right on a cable car line so it's an easy and fun ride to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and Pier 39.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We loved the executive club lounge

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved staying at this hotel. The staff were very pleasant and informative. The hotel was clean and lovely.

review.title: Very nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, very helpful. overall a great place to stay.

review.title: Great view and location
review.reviewText: Room small but otherwise fine with a great view of the city. Concierge and everyone else very helpful in arranging tours, giving direction etc. Close to cable cars.Don"t miss breakfast at the "Top of the Mark". It's expensive but worth it for the panoramic view (don't go when the fog rolls in).

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel with impecable service, however, the rooms are a bit on the small size.

review.title: See you again!
review.reviewText: It was my wife's birthday and she has been talking about a trip to San Fran without the kids. I booked the Mark Hopkins because a couple we are friends with were also staying there and they are very seasoned world travellers: I knew they would pick a great hotel. We were more than impressed with everything: bell hop service; front desk service; room size, bed size, linen quality, bathroom size and amenities, etc. etc. The Top of The Mark was amazing: the views, the food, the couple next to us that got engaged and the service made it a night to remember. The location could not have been better for walking to Union Square or riding a cable car to Fisherman's Warf or walking to any of the world class restaraunts in the city (PLOUF was our favorite on Belden in the Finanacial District -- short downhill walk. Wolfgang Puck's POSTRIO was dynamite.) We loved it ALL.

review.title: A Memorable Experience
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay and will recommend it to all our friends and family.

review.title: Top of the Mark is Top's!
review.reviewText: Wonderful during the Holiday Season & Great Views of the city!
